My G/F suggests we go get burritos at Papalote, because she has been to the Mission location.  O.K. but lets go to the Fulton locaton because it is closer to our digs in the Parkside/Sunset......Agreed!!!!

Whoa Nelly.....Not what I expected in a Mexican Grill at all...Lets run it down!!   1) Smell, oh my... as you walk in the door you can't avoid the smell of toxic cleaning solution of some sort, 2) Decor, holes in walls, cart of dirty dishes and trash to greet you by the door, boxes of supplies stacked up in the hallway leading to the bathroom and a floor with food and napkins strewn about (yuk), 3) Staff, girl behind the counter taking our order had one to many piercings and the last one may have caused her to lose her personality, no greeting, short answers, no thanks or enjoy your food, nada!! 4) Finally, The Food.  As average as they come, very very average for $10.... Not going to say bad, just average.

Truely only a 1 star experience, but an extra star for the Vegan beans, wheat tortilla and fabulous Salsa (not enough to carry this joint in my opinion).

I may give this grill a second chance if I find myself with a 10 spot, a hangover, starving and stuck on Fulton St., barring those conditions I will walk across the street and get a packaged sandwich from Luckys...

I love Yelp, it makes me funny :-)
author: B M.

description:
I came here to grab a quick dinner with some friends the night before running a half marathon (does this count as carbo loading?). A word of warning: I'm not a huge burrito connoisseur, as I count Chipotle as one of my favorite burrito places, so take this review with a grain of salt. I got the super burrito with grilled chicken, which was yummy (especially with the orange sauce), but did not sit well in my stomach (my friend can attest to this). I'm not saying it was the burrito, per se, but then again, I don't know what else it could have been.

-L.
author: Leeann C.

description: I think when a place is famous for its chips and salsa, the main menu items must not be that great. Not to say the food is bad but it is pretty average. I've had the tacos and the burritos and tried different meats but I would still prefer a more authentic taqueria in the Mission. Prices are also more expensive and you just don't get the same Mexican food satisfaction. The salsa is the only thing worth trying at the end of the day.
author: Ed L.

description: Food was okay. I am a take out champ and proud of it. I went here a month ago getting takeout the first time and dining in the second time. The first time I got takeout from the location on Masonic and Fulton. The food cold by the time I got home and I live about 10-15 minutes away. I ordered the carne Asada burrito because of how good my friends said It was. The burrito was dry and kept getting dryer the more I tried to overlook it. The only way I was able to finish the burrito without having to swamp my mouth with coca cola was to douse it with the salsa. The salsa was absolutely f***ing delicious. It was the reason why this got a three star instead of a two. One thing that you should know is that the salsa is purred and not chunky. This makes it better for burritos compared to chips. I ordered a side order of the habbenero salsa which was so delicious. The problem was I couldn't taste the burrito with the amount of salsa needed to make it non dry. After this unfortunate take out experience I wanted to try the actual burrito in house. I went with a friend and he ordered the chicken casadilla. The casadilla came out cold and was really dry also which I have never experienced with a casadilla before. My carne Asada burrito came out dry yet again making me realize that this wasn't going to be a difference weather dining in or taking out. I wouldn't go back here again.
author: Kiran K.

description:
Having been a fan of Papalote in the Mission, I was delighted to find out that the "burrito joint" my GF wanted to hit up was the new Papalote in the Haight/Western Addition.
My taste test was their fish tacos...and of course...they didn't disappoint..Parking was much easier, too. So glad to have a Paplote closer to me.
author: Mimi T.

description:
In a city where so many of the taquerias are almost indistinguishable (yet good!), Papalote has some unique flavors and awesome salsa.
Definitely worth a visit.

Bottom line: recommended, and spring for the salsa.  You won't regret it.
author: dan s.

description:
Service: This place seems to be more take-out than anything else
Food eaten: Super burrito
Price: Okay
Would I come here again: No.

So I came here a few weeks ago after finishing a pretty good workout so needless to say, I was starving. I came stopped here on my way to a friends place because one of my friends told me that I have to stop by here if for nothing else but the tomato salsa, which they are known for. 

I like the fact that they give you a variety of choices for tortillas and beans, which is always a plus in my book. So I'm standing there waiting in line to place my order and this place is just packed. Good sign right? So I place my order and ask about having my salsa on the side and getting extra. The girl helping me says, ya, not a problem as she starts taking the order from the person behind me. Great, everything is looking good and I can't wait for my food. 

So I wait. And wait. And wait. I see several people who came in after me get their meals before mine. I continue to wait. Finally after waiting for 20 minutes, they finally call my name. At this point I am so hungry I just don't care anymore plus I'm freezing to death cuz I'm still in my shorts. So I look in the bag and see that there is only one thing of salsa so I ask the guy for another. $0.50 he tells me. I just look at him like are you kidding? So I say forget it and just take off. 

At this point I am really hoping that this place lives up to its name cuz damn, I am pretty annoyed. So I get to my friends place and try out the burrito thinking that its going to be on par with El Faralito or at least be slightly behind. Its not. Far from it, its a pretty standard burrito. So then I put some of this "famous" salsa on it thinking that it'll do the trick. Nope. Nothing special to me. Needless to say, the burrito was a disappointment to me and for the 20 minute wait I endured waiting for this thing, it just wasn't worth it. For the price and half the wait time, I can visit my favorite burrito joint in the city and get twice the burrito with 4x the taste all for the same price!

Its a pretty safe bet that I won't be eating here again.
author: Richard L.

description:
People rave about this place, saw it in 7x7 Magazine, on the Food Network etc. So I check it out last Sunday night with family.

I was disappointed. It wasn't bad, but it is not my style. 

The Good: 
Chips are toasty and tasty. Salsa is unique and flavorful. 
People who work there are friendly. 
The burrito is large (even the regular sized one) and different (tortilla is grilled instead of steamed, and they offered Chicken Mole).

The Not-So-Good: 
Limited and cramped seating.
The priciest burrito I've had in SF. 
Did not like the grilled tortilla, which made the burrito feel even heavier than usual. 
Did not meet the hype or expectations. 

This one is going to depend on whether you like their style of burrito or not. It's not for me.
author: J C.

description:
Ok so I had to update my review being that they just won the Bobby Flay Throwdown... I had to remove a star mainly for this 1 reason.

Just because you win a Bobby Flay throwdown doesn't mean that you gotta up the price of your Triple Threat Burrito to $19.95. I mean c'mon now... $20 for a burrito? Is that really justifiable? Regardless of what's in it, its still JUST A BURRITO. But oh well, so much for my interest in trying this burrito.. Even if it was the best burrito in the world I would still have a hard time swallowing the fact that I just spent 20 bucks on a burrito... Foreal, I am not that baller.

Prawn burrito is still a fav + salsa is the BOMB but yo, for $19.95 I'd better get me a burrito+a chance to high five each Triple Threat member simultaneously with one arm swing...or maybe a Captain Planet high five where they all meet in the middle.. I would accept either one.
author: Adrian S.

description: I haven't written  a review in a year and a half but after eating at papalote all i can say is eat somewhere else.  the burrito is bland and not much different than chipotle.  I actually prefer chipotle to papalote since its a bit cheaper.  damn food network! tricked me once with gorilla bbq (this is the last time i trust Guy on DDD, for god sake he was the spokesman for TGIF restaurants) in pacifica and now you've tricked me again with papalote (on throwdown w/ Booby Flay)
author: Stephen C.

description:
Always Delicious always Great.
this is my jam:
Veggie burrito
regular
spinach tortilla
refried black beans
EXTRA HOT SAUCE INSIDE!!!!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

im from San Diego- they have a different type of burrito but PAPALOTE IS SOOO FREAKIN GOOD!! 

MY FAVORITE!!!!
author: Elliott G.

description:
I have to say, I'm quite a fan of the slightly healthier taqueria trend, but I didn't find Papalote to be quite as good as Little Chihuahua or Fillmore Mexican Grill. 

Everything is made to order, and the prawns in my burrito were certainly good. Only problem was that most of the flavor in my burrito was the tasteless filler rice/beans as there wasn't enough guacamole, salsa or cheese to even notice. I eventually found the guacamole, but right at the end. 

The chips and salsa were also decent, but not necessarily worth putting on a must-do list.
author: Ryan V.

description:
If you're from LA or San Diego or pretty much anywhere in the Southwestern United States (oh and possibly Chicago) this place rates a "meh" at best. 

Trust me, you've had better. Save your money.
author: Amberjae F.

description:
Highly recommended!

It's no wonder this place has 700 something reviews and happens to be my the first place I write a review about since moving to SF, because this place is the shit. But be warned, it's anytime you're hungry, this place is likely to be PACKED with other hungry souls waiting for nourishment. 

Truthfully, I'm impressed by the amount of loyalty people have to this place. You've gotta walk through the crowd to get to the register to order and I haven't seen one person turn around when they got to the door yet. 

That said, I'm not a vegan, but their vegan options are EXCELLENT. I've gotten soyrizo tacos and burritos and you can't even tell that it's not real meat. The ingredients are fresh, the guacomole is tasty, and the salsa has an amazing kick. I'm lucky this place is only one block away from me, now I know just to call ahead and pick up instead of fighting for a spot to the register.
author: Sho B.

description:
What's with all the hype? My girlfriend and I used to eat at this place all the time. Keyword is "used." first of all, the food is nothing special. I've had much better burritos and salsa at numerous amounts of places... But some people say this as the best burrito in the city. I live in Hayes Valley and its not even the best burrito in the neighborhood.
Tonight, my girlfriend and I attempted to eat dinner here, and the customer service was so bad and conditions so disgusting I will never go back.there were piles of trash against the wall, bus bins of dishes overflowing with food...but we were very hungry and pressed on. However, we never got our food, the table next to us received our food. The wait staff, instead of trying to make a bad situation better, gave us our money back with no apologies. 
So we spent an hour of our lives in this garbage dump for no reason. Is the restaurant business doing so well that restaurants can I'll treat their loyal customers like trash? I for one, will never go back and will never buy their salsa.
author: david s.

description:
It's true, they have probably the best hot sauce I've had in San Francisco.

Born and raised on Southern California burritos, I have come to the realization after moving to SF that I am some what of a Burrito snob.

I know, I'm not proud of it. But when you're raised on the best, your expectations are naturally going to be high.

I got their Super Chicken Burrito, and it was solid. My boyfriend however was rather disappointed with his carne asada burrito.

I am excited to hear that they are apparently selling their sauce in bottled form now. The only thing that bothered me about the place was that even though I am sure they are well aware of the popularity of the sauce, they only give you one container per burrito.

I mean, come on! Where I come from you get a handful! Don't skimp on the very thing that you are so well known for.

But nevertheless, delicious hot sauce, and a pretty good burrito.  Doesn't have the authentic taste that I long for, but never the less a solid SF burrito. Better than many I've had here.
author: Katie S.

description:
I almost always get the fish burrito...it never fails me.

Cant resist the sauce either...my girl gets mad at me when I finish my sauce and I start dipping in hers. but the argument is worth the deliciousness!
author: John E.

description:
Chile Verde Burrito. Amazing.

Made my boyfriend come up from Santa Cruz to eat one, they are too amazing. I don't think I could eat any other chile verde burrito and be as happy.
author: Nicole B.

description:
My classmates and I had a break before our BLS class, so we ate here.. not bad and the price was great.

Service was fast as well. 

I had some great nachos and burrito.

Price is about right.

Parking sucks!!!
author: Roger A.

description: Place is incredible. All I have to say. The burritos are amazing. Try the carne asada  Then jump up to the fish. It legit.
author: Matt R.

description: Food is pretty good, I've only ordered their burritos.  They are way too stingy with their salsas.  They give you one small sample serving with any to-go meal, and an extra is .50 cents?  For that move, I'd give them only 2.5 stars.
author: Andrew R.

description: My burrito was huge and delicious.  It turned into three meals.  I love that they offer whole wheat tortillas.  The free chips and salsa is nice too.
author: Christy L.

description:
Another place where I am torn between 3 and 4 stars.

Let's start with the good stuff.  The location is always super clean, cashiers friendly and food cooked only after ordering.  They might be known for their triple threat burrito but really come on, who can really eat that and not die.  I think Papalote's  #1 is chilaquiles (which is basically loaded with the salsa).  This dish is sooooo good and I haven't been able to find anywhere else that makes it as good!  Next time you're there for brunch and lunch, please get it and give me your feedback.

That said, why I considered giving this place three stars is besides the salsa and chilaquiles, nothing on the menu stands out to me.  I get the company's motto, to make "California" or healthy Mexican food, but that doesn't mean it needs to lack flavor; Everything else I've ordered as been mediocre.  Another compliant is the place opens at 11 am!  It's pretty hard waking up hung over and hungry and ALL i want is  chilaquiles.  My friends and I would seriously just hang out counting down the minutes until we can finally leave our appt and head over.  Please Papalote, please consider opening a little earlier on the weekends!
author: Laura H.

description:
1. Large portions
2. Great salsa bar & salsa!
3. Fresh ingredients & good range of choices
4. Reliable & fast
author: W. W.

description: Burritos are standard (not much to say). However, the salsa is awesome; it has a little spice and isn't watery but thick (I wonder if they put cream in it). Unfortunately they charge 50-75 cents if you want more and I use a lot so there is never enough for a burrito.
author: Brandon R.

description:
This place is right next to campus, so this is usually the first option when we want to eat off campus, but don't want to walk too far. It's a good place to get a quick burito and hang out with your friends ,and it's not ridiculously expensive (although it could be a bit cheaper, since it's a block from a large amount of poor college kids). The burritos are made fresh, there is a lot of variety, and the employees are nice and helpful whenever you order something. I have never had to wait more than 10-15 minutes for my burrito, which is great. 

IT is a bit expensive for a fast food style mexican food place (a burrito and drink is about 10 bucks), and for that price, I would expect more food/ a bigger drink. The burritos are good, but I would like my dollars to stretch a bit further. Also, the place itself is tiny, so finding a place to sit can be near impossible when others are there, which gets a bit annoying. 

I would say if you need a quick meal and want a burrito, this is a good place to go, but if you're looking for a serious Mexican meal, look a bit further.
author: Sean F.

description:
Pros:
1. Fast service, never have to wait to long in line or for your order to be completed.  
2. Fairly large menu covering all the normal Mexican dishes. 
3. Great house salsa.  

Cons:
1. Not the best prices for fast food Mexican.  
2. None of the food stands out as being particularly better than any other Mexican food.
author: Jason H.

description:
I love to eat at places that are featured on the food network, and because I saw throwdown I wanted to see what the real deal is... Honestly, there is no realy big deal, the place was mediocre, packed, and because they are soo busy & small (Size of restaurant), it takes them 30 minutes just to take our order, 30 minutes, to be seated, and then another 30 minutes to enjoy your chips and salsa--Which by the way was soo much better than the burrito...

I still wonder until this day why bobby flay lost this one... I guess the salsa did do it's trick, because if anything the salsa is what earned this place the 3 stars I am giving it... The triple threat was $20, it needed to be eaten with a fork and knife because the meat pieces were too big to eat, which in my books is not a burrito... It's a rice plate.. :) 

Just a tip, the burrito would have been better if you cut the meat smaller, and the meat was just a little bit more seasoned... THE SALSA THOUGH, that's a review on its own... Loved that... Do you sell it by the jar? Because I would seriously buy it...

Overall, location is great, food is ok, salsa is fantastic, service was kind of slow, staff is great, and if you are lucky you may be served in a timely matter... Other than that, try not to go there on a busy night because you may not eat for about an hour & a half....
author: Shirlene M.

description:
This place is ok. The flavors are nice and clean...but that's not really what I look for in my carne asada burrito. As a SF native, I've had my fair share of Mexican food, and I prefer something more akin to, say, Cinco De Mayo...something a little but more flavorful..a little messier...and doesn't require any addiitional salsas/hot sauces, which my Papalote burrito did. I though it was missing something, but it could have just been that they messed up my order and didn't add sour cream, which made me weep a little.

If I were in the neighborhood, I wouldn't mind going again...but honestly, there are better places in the city.
author: Morgan L.

description:
Good friendly staff greeted me right away and took my order. I had the carne asada burrito with black beans, guacamole, and sour cream.

The chips are great and the salsa they give you is even better. The burrito was pretty good, however I paid almost $10 for it. While it was large, I would have liked to see more meat in it for that price.
author: Luis B.

description:
I'll start by saying, I live in the neighborhood and it's a rare week when I don't go here at least once.  I've had a lot of their food and have to say that they are my favorite taqueria in SF.  I'm a carnivore, so I'll stick to reviewing that stuff (though they do have tofu-based and veggie-based options that look good)

A TIP WITH THE CROWD
If you are wanting something to go and arrive to find the line out the door, just step outside and phone in your order.  Then go straight to the front of the line and pay them (they ask that phone orders get paid at the front of the line...who are you to complain;)  I know it's working the system, but hey, sometimes you gotta get your fix fast.

RESTAURANT
It's a tight galley-style restaurant (far smaller than the Mission district location).  Seating is a little bit limited.  It's not super relaxing to eat there, but if you get a spot at one of the tables in the front you'll be out of the foot traffic of people waiting in line.

BURRITOS 
Great, fresh ingredients. The anchiote chicken is my favorite.  Ton of flavor.  Try the super chicken burrito with whole black beans.  It's a nice combo.

PLATES
Aside from burritos and tacos, Papalote does a nice set of plates.  My favorites are the Chicken al Pechuga (sp?) and the Chicken Mole plate.  The Chile Verde is good too but I find it to be unreasonably spicy sometimes.

All in all, they keep me coming back.
author: michael l.

description:
I was craving some Mexican food, particulary some chips and salsa.  Since this place was on 7x7 magazine's 100 places to eat, particularly for their chips and salsa, I've always wanted to try it.  My hubby and I were going to the city anyway, so we decided to make a stop at this place for a quick lunch.

The salsa was admittedly good, but I'm not sure if I would call it "the best ever".  The chips were ok, but I prefer superthin chips to the thick ones they serve here.  I was here for the chips and salsa (which I can eat all day), but I figure I should at least give their other food a try.  I wound up getting the chicken mole tacos, which were pretty good.  entree-sized portion.  It was a decent-sized portion for lunch, larger than taco-trucks but not ginormous like what you would get as an entree at most mexican restaurants.

It was a good experience overall, but with all the good mexican places in the Mission, I'd probably try a few other restaurants before going back to this one.
author: Arlene M.

description: 2 stars due to the price/no tapatio sauce. Paid $15 for a "prawn" burrito and coke. The prawns were tiny, I wonder what the shrimp look like? Rice was undercooked. Only reason I come here is because its close to USF.
author: Daniel A.

description:
i live nearby and when i'm lazy to cook which is pretty freakin often, i come here for a bite to eat. their burritos are very large and tasty and their hot sauce is what keeps me coming back for more! its spicy but very unique from other mexican joints. 

tasty and friendly staff! 5 stars for you Papalote!
author: Cicely T.

description:
So, I finally was able to try out the Chicken Adobo Burrito today...Oh my...I'm in love with a MexiPino.  Who would've thought that chicken adobo and garlic rice would go so well in a tortilla?  Genius!  Right on, Miguel and Victor!  These past few years have been going well for Papalote...what will they come up with next?  
Reminder!  Throwdown with Bobby Flay on Feb 17!!!!!  Check it!
author: Jennifer L.

description: What a disappoint. The food was ho-hum and the place smelled like bathroom cleaner. It's cramped and the staff seemed really stressed out.
author: Carrie F.

description:
Excellent burrito!

We both had the chicken mole super burrito. It was a *giant* amount of food, delicious to the end. We will definitely be back for more!
author: Karen C.

description:
I almost wonder if there is something wrong with me after reading all the positive reviews. 
While going to school nearby, I swapped between this place and getting a sandwich at Lucky for lunch depends on which style of mediocrity I wanted for the day. 
I tried a variety of items from the menu and they all lacked any true flavor, everything was bland, everytime.
author: Aaron R.

description: Went with some friends that live walking distance to the place. They're vegetarian and I am a vegan and we all chose something easily! I got a giant burrito! They're salsa is really good. Not super spicy.
author: Justine L.

description:
All I can say is.... probably the neatest and cleanest burrito I have EVER eaten in my life that tasted FABULOUS. whoa.. I ATE THE WHOLE THING!!! Usually I eat half a burrito and im done... i can't believe I just finished one whole burrito today!!! =X

I got a Carne Asada Burrito- DINE IN. 
Taste= GREAT!! The steak had really good flavor! I loved the the tortilla, It stayed crispy and fresh till the last bite. Usually by the midpoint, my burrito becomes soggy already but NOT THIS MONSTer!

One thing I would request next time is extra salsa.... they skimped on my salsa which made my burrito less exciting, but I will definitely come back!
author: A L.

description:
Great good quality meat grilled to perfection.
Salsa is a must try and it's free. (chips included)
author: Kasra V.

description: Prices are great.  People are nice. Large selection. and the food is SOO GOOD.
author: Dawn L.

description:
I like the concept - clean, healthier, cooked to order Mexican food, open kitchen, reasonable prices - but flavor tends to be lacking from the burritos and tacos.  I've been here a couple of times and they never give you enough salsa (and there's no salsa bar).  I need much more of that house chipotle salsa (which I do like - it's smoky, spicy and thick), especially since the food is not that flavorful.  

I've never eaten at the actual location (I take it to go) because the space is so small and cramped (it's uncomfortable to even wait for your order inside) but I usually do my grocery shopping across the street at Lucky's and then pick up my order when I'm done.  It's usually pretty busy, especially in the evenings, so it takes a long time (20 minutes or more) to get your order.  I'm not sure why it's THAT slow every time I go there.  

I don't experience the same burrito coma that I get at other places which is probably a good thing.  The food isn't super salty either.  The main drawbacks are stinginess with salsa and being the slowest place in SF and possibly the entire world, to get a burrito.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Definitely a solid burrito place. Has great consistency with its cousin in the Mission. My gripes are like this:
1) It does not have the same selection as many many other awesome mexican spots.
2) The salsa is good, but they limit your salsa intake in a silly way.
author: Louis A.

description: I absolutely love this place! Best burritos and salsa ever and I have never had a problem with service. I wish they had one where I lived. I miss you papa.
author: Nicole A.

description:
I'm from LA where Mexican food is abundant and authentic. So when I was up in the Bay, I was feigning for a burrito and asked about a good place where I can get one. Friend said Papalote because it has won awards. A mexican joint winning awards for their burritos?!? OK, I'm game...

I was gonna get the carne asada, but friend told me to get the SOY RIZO. A vegan burrito??? I put a 'super' order on it and this burrito BEATS all the late night taco trucks in LA - HANDS DOWN! I love me some Sunset & Alvarado taco trucks, but Papalote puts them all to shame. Seriously.

So the next night, I told my fellow LA buddies to go and try it. We had dinner at another restaurant beforehand, went to Papalote to get burritos to eat for later, but it smelled so good, that we ate the burritos on top of being full! And their reaction was the same as mine. 

SUPER FANTASTIC BURRITOS!!!!!!
author: Angela A.

description:
This place is PRICEY but soooo yummy. I think this was the first place EVER where i had to pay almost $10 for a small burrito but still think that it was totally worth it. 

Their burritos arent dry and their sauce that comes with the chips just goes SO WELL with the burrito (extra = charge). 

I usually get the carne asada or chicken burrito-- super with everything in it. But the size isnt that big-- not as big as the one from Panchos or anywhere else i've tried. But it tastes good.

Although this place is literally a hole in the wall and seating is limited-- you should most definitely try it and see for your self if a burrito is worth ten dollars-- away from the mission!
author: Hanna K.

description:
Better than average, for sure. But why would it take 20 mins to make a quesadilla?? Seriously, I've been here before and will likely come back, if just for the vegetarian/vegan options, the mole, and the orange salsa.

But the ordering system is completely inefficient, which only compounds the fact that the restaurant is already housed in a very cramped space. Either way, I should be able to walk in and get a quesadilla in less than 20 minutes! C'mon! You're a Cal-Mex taqueria. I'll keep returning here, but... Get your act together, Papalote!
author: Jake G.

description:
If you're hungry this is it. The burrito is big.  Chicken or veggie are my favorite. I am not a fan of the tacos or the mole but when i'm looking for one of the best burritos I love Papalote.  

The must have is the home made salsa (sauce)!  I don't know what they put in it but i could eat a whole jar.  I suggest getting some extra.  Thank me later.
author: A S.

description:
I saw this place on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay" and I wanted to swing by the place since I was in the area.

I got the carne asade burrito with "super" (additional $0.99-guacamole, sour cream) also came with chips and salsa. I will say that I enjoy hot salsa's and this was a more sweet and tangy version.  However the carne asade meat was to die for. It was grilled nicely and l love black beans!!

I would definitely try this place again to try some of the other dishes.

Price was moderate.
author: Janet K.

description: I pay $12 for a burrito and they can't even fold it right. Foods decent, seating is crowded.
author: Brock L.

description:
If you go to this place make sure you take home some of their delicious salsa, you can buy it by the jar and put it on just about anything! My boyfriend and I bought it the last time we went and we went thru that stuff faster than a street hooker will jump into your car.

you can put it on almost anything... burritos, nachos, eggs, steak, the possibilities are endless and DELICIOUS!
author: Antonia R.

description:
I started at USF in August and a lot of people were telling me about papalote and how i HAD to try it.  Stopped by here today since I was a little early to meet a partner for a project and I hadn't eaten lunch.

I was a little bummed that i didn't see a carnitas option for the meats but i got over that and got a carne asada super burrito (black beans, rice, cheese, guac, sour cream) and a glass of the horchata.  It also came with a bowl of chips and their own salsa which I will admit is mighty tasty.  The burrito itself was what i expected it to be though the meat is also mighty tasty as well.  The horchata is some of the best i've had, on par with the stuff you can get from places in the mission or other greasy mexcian food vendors in the city.

At a little more than $11 it is more than i would normally pay for a burrito and a drink but as a once every now and then indulgence I would fork it over.
author: Chris C.

description: Good burrito, but in the category of super burritos this one is a little on the smaller side and a bit more expensive than most taquerias.  The meat is cooked to order which is nice, but then again it also means that your burrito won't be done by the time you finish paying.  The inside of the burrito can get a little mushy, but it's still quite tasty nonetheless with the fresh ingredients and lightly grilled, crispy tortilla.
author: Erich D.

description:
So my friend tells me I NEED to try the burritos from this place, so before dropping me off @ the airport, we stopped by.

I ordered a chicken quesadilla and a carne asada burrito w/ pink beans & sour cream.  I asked for extra sour cream and they wanted to charge me $2.25! I said FORGET ABOUT IT...

Chicken quesadilla was pretty slamming!! The cheese is what really makes this food really good.

I ate the burritto after I boarded the plane and I wasn't amazed.  I shared 1/2 and my friend thought it was GREAT.  I really enjoyed the chips they put in the bag w/ the salsa.

I've had better mexican food for BETTER price...
I made it out of there spending like $19 and change...
a little steep for a burrito & quesadilla in my books.
author: Sarah L.

description: Haven't been here for a few years. Got a chicken burrito. The flavor was good but the texture of the chicken was effen weird. It like popped when I chewed it. No bueno. If I hadn't been here before I wouldn't go back but because I have and it's been good I will. No pollo loco, though.
author: m t.

description:
pretty good food here and always satisfied after my meal. A little pricey, but close by so I can't complain much. The men who work there are sweethearts, while the girls at the cash registers (evening workers) always have a bitchy look on their faces.  They should probably smile more if they want tips.

Definitely try it!
author: ned l.

description:
Went to this place after seeing its Mission location on Bobby Flay's Throwdown.  

Places they show on Food Network or Travel Channel have a tendency to be overrated and this one cannot live up to the hype.  The food is definitely good but for every one of these places they show on TV, there are a half a dozen other decent options in the area. 

What makes this place stand out are the seafood and vegetarian options.  They can add soyrizo and marinated tofu in the burritos.  The seafood was okay but the taste of the seafood tended to be overwhelmed by the rest of the burrito.  

Price is a little on the high side, as well. The listed prices are for burritos without extras like guacamole and cheese.  If you want those (and who doesn't?), it raises the price.  Also, they have a lot of workers in the front but half of them seem to be just standing around.  Doesn't look good to have inattentive workers.

The quality of the food is four star.  Solid, but not the best just because Bobby Flay says so.
author: Re-pley Z.

description: Papalote is SO GOOD!  This is your go-to burrito joint. Amazing carne asada burritos. Amazing salsa. Sometimes I come here just to buy salsa. Good for take-out.
author: Dana B.

description:
5 stars for the salsa alone.  have i been living in a cave that i hadn't heard the hype about this place before?  A friend took me for lunch last week and i'll be back for sure.  the salsa is saucier than most, and i'm jumping on the bandwagon.  

my burrito was large, filling, and i liked the tortilla's texture.  it wasn't the most amazing burrito i've eaten, but the ingredients were all tasty and fresh, so it's a win in my book.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
This place seems to have gone down hill.

 I happened to be in the neighborhood today, so I decided to indulge in some awesome Soy Rizo burrito. However, that awesomeness was nowhere to be found today. The soy rizo burrito was mushy, tasteless and pretty expensive. It seems that someone forgot to salt the rice. On top of everything, the chips were super stale.

Just head to Green Chile Kitchen, a few blocks away, for a better burrito. Oh, and if it's Papalote's salsa that you crave, you can get just their salsa to go in a large jar. It's not listed on the menu though.
author: Tushar V.

description:
Okay, like most of the people who saw it on the news or maybe even watched "Throw Down With Bobby Flay," I had to make a visit this afternoon since I'm a big boy who loves his burritos.  I called in to place an order for myself and three of my fellow workers.  I asked about that special burrito they call the "Triple."  I laughed outloud when they said it was $19.95 versus $8 - $10 for the other burritos.  I said, it's $20?  They said, no, it's $19.95.  Okay, true.  WIth all the media hype and never having a burrito for $19.95, I tried it.  I admit that it was really good.  But not bigger than the Prawn burrito, Chorizo burrito or the Carne Asada burrito.  Had the same amount of meat as the others, very delicious, big for a big boy, but definitely not worth $20.

I will go back over and over again.  I will never order the Triple burrito and for $20, I'd rather order a chicken burrito and a carne asada burrito and still have change left over.  Hey, if you have the $20 to spare, try it, but personally, it's not worth it.  Again, delicious, just too expensive compared to their other similar, delicious burritos.

Also, the associates (especially Sheena) were very nice with the phone orders.  Yay! I'm a fan.  Just not a fan of the Triple.
author: Frank C.

description:
After getting some experience at court on Tuesday, I had to go straight to class and didn't have time to stop at the school cafeteria for lunch so one of my classmates suggested we grab something to go from this place.  So we did.

I have a hard time deciding on what I want usually but I thought I did pretty good while I was standing there reading their menu.  Until the cashier b*&@h kept asking me every 30 seconds if I was "ready yet" in this boring monotone of hers.  No, dammit!  If I was, I would've come up to you!  Bad start.  Anyways, I decided on a Carne Asada Quesadilla.  When she was ringing me up, she charged me for guacemole I never even asked for.  Whatever.  I didn't have time to complain so I let it go.  

While waiting for my food, I watched the guys behind the counter do their thing.  And then, one of them took a towel that looked like it's been used all day without a wash, wipe the counters, and then wipe the knife he was using to cut up the meat.  Barf.  I couldn't bear to look anymore, especially when my quesadilla came up next so I just stared at the walls.  When my number came up, I just took my bag and ran.  If I wasn't hungry, I would've just tossed it.  But I threw caution to the wind, opened my bag, and started chomping down.  Then I noticed they left out the guacemole I was charged but never asked for.  Sad day, sad day.

About $8 for a Carne Asada Quesadilla (who knows what else was in it), chips and salsa.  Don't think I'll come back here again unless I have to.  When that time comes, hopefully they can redeem themselves.  Until then, for Mexican food, I think I will stick to El Farolito in Mission which is awesome and has the best salsa ever.
author: Linh V.

description:
Shrimp tacos - yummy yummy love you long time.  Simple...but so tasty, what do you put in them to make them soooo addicting? 

Now that they are selling the salsa in a jar - oh man...I will be going there for take out every few weeks, just to keep fresh papalote salsa in my fridge at all times.  They are a bit stingy with their salsa - they charge you for each extra one. But it's soooo worth it. And I consider myself pretty much a salsa expert.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Sorry, Papalote... I really wanted to like you. But it's hard to go to a place where the chips and salsa are so hyped up and get stale chips... I just don't get it. How did this happen?

The burrito and tacos we got were good. The carne asada is good so you get 3 stars for that.  But I still can't get past the chips. Also, I'm not sold on creamy salsa... We should probably all ask ourselves if salsa should really be creamy at all...jury is still out for me.
author: Abbey S.

description:
Great burrito! I went here for the first time on Valentine's Day & I was not disappointed. I ordered a carne asada burrito with black beans & made is "super" which includes cheese, sour cream, & guac for only $0.99! I ate most of it & was extremely satisfied. I absolutely love the chips & special salsa that comes with it.

Small cons is the sitting is definitely limited and the bathroom was out of paper towels. 

Next time I'm in the city & in need of a burrito fix, this will be the spot!
author: Ashlee C.

description:
I love me some papalote. 

This is not a typical dirty burrito; but it's not quite fancy either. It's a good mix between the two. This is great because it means they cater to the SF clientele and have a good spread of veggie options. And when I say good spread, I mean some of their veggie burritos are to die for. 

You won't even miss the meat in the soyrizo burrito. Get some grilled veggies and it's a flavor explosion. 

It's always super crowded, but if you wait long enough and vulture, you can usually get a table. 

And it goes without saying that their salsa is magical. I've heard you can bring a mason jar and buy some to bring it home - I should do that!!!
author: Liz S.

description:
Everyone has to try the mole chicken taco here.  I like this place because the food is healthy, reasonably priced, and delicious.  The atmosphere is light and clean, with a few tables at the window and a long counter to eat at.  The menu offers a variety of dishes to try, as well as beer and aqua frescas.  

Everyone gets a bowl of nachos with a yummy spicy sauce.  My mole chicken taco was delicious.  I recommend ordering the tacos with two shells because they can fall apart and feel flimsy with the standard tortilla.  Each taco comes topped with fresh lettuce and tomato.  I might add a condiment bar because I like loading toppings on my taco.
author: apple r.

description:
when i googled maps it, it brought me somewhere else.  not the other location though.  strange.  

i think i was really famished when i walked in because i ate my food super fast and left really really full.

i got a chicken fajita.  there were grilled veggies, beans (choice), rice, a small helping of jicama salad, and pica de gallo.  they gave me one tortilla.  as i ate it i thought maybe i shouldve just gotten a burrito or something.

its a bit out of the way for people not passing by or nearby.  i dont think i would come here in purpose. in fact we had wanted to go to a crawfish boil at magnolia pub but they were way overcrowded.
author: claudia y.

description:
I like the other location 'cause there is more sitting room.
This place made a very delicious carne asada burrito.
And made my phattyself very happy as I sat on the beach and ate a yummy phatty burrito.
author: Lauren S.

description:
The location is small but the food has big flavor.  Definitely try the prawns.  I also get the chicken, usually in tacos but sometimes in a burrito if I'm really hungry.  Their signature burrito is the Triple Threat although I haven't tried that yet.  The chorizo con huevo is mildly spicy and makes for a filling breakfast.

Make sure you call the Fulton St. location if you're ordering to go -- there's another location at 24th St. & Valencia.  They usually tell me my food will be ready in 10 - 15 minutes but it's usually ready in half the time.
author: Arthur C.

description:
No wonder Papalote championed the Throwdown with Bobby Flay...this place had the best carne asada super burrito. The prawns tacos were good too. But I have to say they have the Best House Salsa!!! For me the salsa was on the spicy side, but I didn't care I couldn't stop eating the nacho chips it came with. I had chapped lips the following day ;-) 

Friendly and fast service!
author: Eva D.

description: Probably one of the best burritos in the city, hands down the best burrito in the USF/Richmond area by far!
author: Matthias K.

description: I thought these were just your typical SF burritos (albeit with the best salsa ever) until I had the mole tofu.  Holy Mole!!  Why was this burrito not in my life sooner?!  So. damn. good. that I ate the whole burrito at lunch.  Which meant I looked pregnant the rest of the day.  And yet it was so delicious, that I was ok with my freakishly large burrito belly.  Good times papalote.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Same great food, but the atmosphere isn't as cool.  Too loud.  
The Fish Burrito is fantastic an unlike I've had anywhere else!
author: Mark B.

description:
Look at me, eating my own words. 

My office orders lunch in once a week for everyone and we've been pushing for Papalote for a while. The office is at the far edge of the Financial District, almost at the Embarcadero, and Papalote is... no where near it. 

Shouldn't be a problem, we'll just TaskRabbit it, right? Hmmm... not quite that easy. Just to make sure, I called Paplote on Friday (for a Tuesday order) to make sure there would be no issue with paying on the phone and putting it under someone else's name to pick it up. The girl I spoke with said that wouldn't be a problem, and they only need an hour or so lead time. Monday rolls around, and I get everyone's order together to place. Call them up, give them my order, seems smooth until I try to pay. They inform me that only the manager can take payment over the phone and give me her name and tell me to call back at 11am Tuesday for an 11:30 pickup. 

So I call just after 11am on Tuesday. I ask to speak with the manager directly, and instead of getting a normal response, I get a question... who is that? I repeat the name I was given and am rudely informed that there is no one there with that name. I ask to speak to the manager on duty and am told they're not in yet. I inform them that I was told to call at 11am because that's when the manager would be there, and I need my food to be ready by 11:30am because I already have a TaskRabbit ready to pick it up, and this is just not okay. I hear her set the phone down and tell the "manager" everything I just said. Apparently the "manager" was there this whole time and not taking calls. The same rude girl comes back and says fine, I'll take your credit card info. (I thought only the "manager" could?) So I give it to her, and she says ok, just bring it in with you. I tell her that's not going to happen because we have someone else on their way to pick it up, I can't have them come to the office, grab my card, and then bring it all the way there just to show it, and eitherway, it's my card, and I'm not the one picking it up. As if she wasn't rude enough, she's basically yelling at me saying that they can't do it. Now it's my turn to be firm, and I tell her that she has to do this. I have a whole office of hungry people waiting, I've already set someone up to go pick it up, and she's basically lost at least 10 customers today. 

All in all, they finally agreed to process the order. By the time the food got here, it was a little cold, but fine. I have never experienced such horrible customer service. I was a regular here, but haven't been back since.
author: Brittany P.

description:
MOLE MOLE MOLE!

Great chicken mole :) Delicious recipe unlike any I've had. Free chips with spicy salsa! Great place to grab a late lunch and stuff yourself. It can get really crowded on Saturdays or 7-8 on weekdays.
author: Halley B.

description:
After not being back for about a year, I decided to stop by because I was craving carne asada tacos. WOW!!... When I got home and unwrapped them I was floored and kind of upset! My tacos where lettuce tacos because there was barely any meat. This place is awful. Maybe they just specialize in burritos but how can a Mexican restaurant get tacos so wrong. 
I would pick Chipotle over this place anytime and I grew up eating authentic Mexican food.
author: Rolo A.

description: They say the closer you are to the border, the better the Mexican food. From my experience, Socal burritos beat Norcal burritos any day! I ordered the chicken burrito, it was pretty good. It came with a secret recipe salsa that went perfect with the burrito, not sure if the burrito would be as good without the help of the salsa. But overall, my burrito was filling and flavorful.
author: Briget P.

description: Triple threat burrito, and the best salsa ever. There is a reason these guys beat Bobby Flay!!! A must anytime you visit the City!!
author: Kane S.

description: I have never had a good experience with customer service here. The cashiers always look dead in the eyes like you are wasting their time. You always have to shout over the radio or kitchen worker's jabber.The cooks always forget one of the ingredients I have ordered. When I pay for guacamole, I should maybe get some guacamole. Chips will probably be stale. When they do get it right the food is average at best, I rather hike it to a Chipotle than support this business. Too bad no stars isn't an option.
author: C G.

description:
I must have eaten at an identical mexican restaurant at this precise location, because I just didn't think it captured the same deliciousness as the 24th and Valencia location. The burritos resembled more like the behemoths you find coming from utility mexican joints where half of the burrito is sour cream and rice. Unfortunate, since I live only a few blocks away and would come daily if it was as good as I tasted deep in the heart of the Mission a few months ago.

Also, the cashier DEFINITELY didn't want to be there that day, and was not very helpful.
author: Andy A.

description:
Like countless others I had to try the triple-threat burrito after seeing it on Throwdown with Bobby Flay.

The restaurant was a zoo on the day we went and better suited for take out than dine in. I've seen better organized ordering queue's as well.

$20.00 for a burrito of any sort seems pretty steep (ok so this one is famous) and I've got to say after eating it I felt a bit short changed. I'm something of a glutton and do appreciate it when a burrito is big enough that I can count on some leftovers. This was one of the smallest burritos I've had in recent memory, and I would hardly say that they were generous with any of the ingredients. The combinations of flavors was pretty good, though nothing really stood out to me either. I suppose I was expecting a bit more after all the hype...

I'll have to try some of there other, more practically priced menu items sometime. I'm glad I gave the triple-threat burrito a try, I just don't think I'll be ordering one again anytime soon.
author: Matt T.

description:
Maybe I should've gotten a burrito or a quesadilla, but there tacos were definitely very average.  Had one chicken and one carne asada, chicken was very dry and not much flavor, carne asada was a bit juicier but still nothing special.

Their salsa was tasty and different, but charging extra for more salsa is like a burger joint charging extra for ketchup...not cool.

I'll stick to my tacos in the mission or at Little Chihuaha
author: Michelle A.

description:
Not bad!

I spent the last four years in San Diego, the mothership of great Mexican food, so I have very high expectations when it comes to Mexican. Solid 3 stars for being a few steps above "eh" and a few notches down from something I would randomly crave. It's also a TAD bit more expensive than I had hoped.

I ordered the super carne asada burrito (super = add cheese, sour cream, and guac) for ~ $9. The carne asada was flavorful and not overly salty.  It's decently sized, but if you didn't order it "super" I can't imagine it being very large... What I liked was the choices of beans (black, pinto, refried black) and tortillas (flour, whole wheat, spinach, roma tomato) that are available upon request.I don't know about eat-in orders, but for takeout they give you chips and their infamous salsa; always a plus. The salsa isn't NEARLY as spicy as I had hoped, but it has a nice smoky flavor in the background that makes it unique. I don't think it lives up to the high reviews as others have noted, though.

I shall come here again because it's close, convenient, and the quality seems pretty consistent.
author: Ronald T.

description:
This place is delicious.

I strongly recommend the prawn quesadilla or mole chicken quesadilla.  And you gotta make them super - they will add sour cream, cheese, and guacamole inside your quesadilla.  I'm more partial to quesadillas, but I love the burritos too.  Make them super as well!

I really like their chips and salsa too.  The salsa is very unique and I have really come to love it.  If you're not going to eat there, call in with your order.  I recommend this especially during the lunch rush (USF students) or if you have ordered something with prawns because they take their time grilling those (worth it).  I grab an Orangina and I'm out.
author: Paz R.

description:
At first I was surprised to see such great reviews on this place. Considering the location about 2 blocks from my school I came here today for lunch. Ordered Super Chicken Nachos-was not too fond of the chicken at all. I liked it without it so I just moved it to the side. I liked the chips though yummy & they gave me an extra bag of chips even though I ordered nachos so that's nice. Inside was clean and service was fast. 

I wouldn't make it a regular stop but I could see how they get a lot of business. Only "mexican" place in the area. Total $9.60 with NO drink seemed like a whole lot. but that's just me,i guess. Go figure.
author: Sarina I.

description:
Great spot! People told me about this place for so long and the one day I finally got around to trying it, it exceeded what I had presumed were over-hyped expectations.

Do this: 
Get 1 steak quesadilla and 1 chicken quesidilla. Make both of them super... 

If you can eat 1 or both and not be satisfied, I don't like you and I don't want to know you.

Great food, Clean, Fast, Serves Mexican Coke (huge for me), and good location, try it out!
author: Sam K.

description:
Wow, how many times have I been to Papalote before finally reviewing it? I can't count. I've probably gone through 50 of those little red free burrito cards. Anyway, it is awesome for a number of reasons, pay attention and you will learn a couple tips and tricks for your next visit:

-the salsa is off the chain. *tip* if you like to put it on your burrito, and you find yourself not having enough left for the chips, ORDER YOUR BURRITO WITH HOT SAUCE INSIDE IT. They call it hot sauce, not salsa, when ordering it inside the burrito. It doesn't cost extra this way, whereas it does cost extra to get another container of it.

-the vegetarian options are great; Soyrizo is especially good

-if you like burritos, make sure you get a little red card and get it punched every time, and get it punched when your lazy friends without cards get burritos too. This way every eleventh burrito you get is free.

-If you're ordering to go anyway, call your order in ahead of time (um, no I don't have them on speed dial). If you call it in, you can skip to the front of the line no matter how many people are waiting.

-the prawn burrito is unreal

The only drawback for me is that the service from the women at the register can be curt and inflexible. A couple of them are great, but many of them seem to give off the "I'm gangster and I'm cooler than you" vibe, which is probably true, but I don't need that when I'm getting a burrito.

Also, for the amount of neighborhood peeps that are absolute regulars here, they hardly engage at all with the local clientele, and seem to treat everyone like a tourist. They don't really ever go out of their way to hook you up, even if they've seen you for six straight days. For example, the finished red card only covers a standard burrito, and I always order guac on it, and they always charge me the extra 1.50 or so instead of just throwing in the guac because I go there all the time. A little customer appreciation would be nice, instead of only taking advantage of their superior food and knowing people will come back.
author: brian b.

description: Tried the chicken mole burrito today and it was amazing. The sauce is delicious. I will definitely be trying Papalote again.
author: Torsten L.

description:
burritos are just always better in california, it's actually a scientific fact. 

these burritos are especially delicious. i have a friend who fancies himself to be a mexican food/burrito conneseiur, so when he was raving about this place, i knew it would be good. i copied him and got the works and put legit everything they had to offer on it, including their medium salsa and guac.i was not disappointed! everything was super fresh and flavorful.

as many pictures have shown, these burritos are beasts- i definitely couldn't finish the burrito in one sitting and i unfortunately had to get on a plane, so i couldn't take it with me. needless to say, i immediately passed out from a food coma on my flight home. 

some have noted, this place isn't exactly spacious, so try and go at off hours or with a small group!
author: Andrea C.

description:
The salsa is amazing!!!!!

I had the super pollo burrito, it was delicious. The ingredients are fresh and the restaurant is kept very clean. One of the best burritos I've had. I will definitely come back!! 

Also - Papalote's Triple Threat burrito won the burrito throwdown with Bobby Flay!
author: Sandy K.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been going for many many years now.  I've observed the quality of food slowly go down over time.  In my opinion, it's accompanied by an attitude shift and "feeling" in the restaurant as a whole.  It's not as energetic, up beat - so I don't know if there was a change in ownership or management or just a burned-out-ness - but they could use a little shot of inspiration to their game on again.  Just went back and ordered a chicken burrito , super, with refried beans.  took it home and it was completely different - I don't know what with black beans dotted in there.  It tasted just "ok" but was completely off from my order. Too bad.
author: D d.

description:
For meat-eating burrito lovers this place has two of the most unique burritos in town; The Chile Verde and The Chicken Mole (regular burritos)

The Chile Verde is pork with so much flavor and tons of garlic.  The Chicken Mole is a bit sweet but also a solid out of the ordinary burritos.

I don't like their regular type burritos (carne asada, etc.) There is no reason to order these types of burros here when you can get them better and cheaper at a million other places.  

The Chile Verde burrito is a one of kind and keeps me coming back year after year.

Also they promote rap concerts and have a DJ crew.  That's kinda tight, right?!?!?
author: Leon S.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago. I ordered the Chicken Nachos. Honestly, I wasn't that impressed. It could have had more chicken, if not, then chop up the chicken strips into dices. 

The place to go for chicken nachos, if you're in the area, is Los Cantaros. Now they have some bomb chicken nachos!

Other than that, I'll try a burrito next time since that's what people seem to order here.

Overall, a thumbs up.
author: Jay C.

description: This was deeerishous and I'm a huge critic of Mexican food. The Triple Threat burrito was WAY WORTH THE $20. Eat it.
author: Justin D.

description:
Tiny place - 3 small tables and a counter.  
Loooong wait - 20 min for 2 burritos???  This looks like a fast food joint, but....
9 bucks for a super burrito???  I pay only $6 at real taquerias
Beans have no taste at all, same with the rice.
Salsa is OK, creamy in texture.  Grilled meats are good.
Street parking can be tough, depending on day/time.  
Way overrated - not coming back here.
author: Byron Y.

description:
Never heard of this place until one day someone from work said 'were ordering from Papalote, what do you want'.  I ordered their carne asada burrito and I thought that they were okay.  I'm Mexican so I am super critical about mexican food and I was just not too impressed with this burrito that I ordered.  It was not bad but it was not great,  it was just good.  

I recommend trying them out if you are debating going here because, like I said, they were not bad.  

Maybe I'll take my bf and actually eat in the restaurant, sometimes that makes a difference.  ??
author: Maria E.

description: The burritos are great quality,  but what makes this place awesome is their Sauce.  You must have it on everything to really appreciate the food here!
author: Greg H.

description:
It's all about that salsa.  
Get your carne asada super burrito HOT - bomb. 

Stay away from the shrimp burrito. Not a fan. 
Go near the --- carne asada tacos --- BOMB BOMB. 
Adobo & garlic rice burrito --- a truely tasty tribute. 

Complete the experience with Cocacola in a glass bottle please. 

(For those coming in a group - this is not a sit-down place.  There are about 2 tables and 1 long counter.  This is a grab and go spot.  The Papalote's in the Mission has more seating available.)
author: Deanna A.

description:
Best salsa in town, and one of the best burritos in the city. 

SF Burritoeaters know what a serious statement this is, but it's true. Everything I've had here is fresh and super-duper tasty. The Pollo burrito: fantastic. The Prawn Burrito: Fantastic. Hell, even the veggie is, you guessed it, FANTASTIC.

I highly recommend buying a jar of salsa ($6, $1 off if you bring back the jar). It has great flavor and is a useful ingredient for a variety of cuisines (I had it on pizza last night and it was great. I've also mixed a couple tea spoons in with my white Cheddar Annie's pasta, adds a ton of flavor). 

The menu is a little on the pricey side, but this will not stop me from continuing to be a regular.
author: Dustin E.

description:
This place is sooooooo good! This is my go-to for mexican. Their salsa is fantastic AND they sell it! The workers are always really nice, and the food is always fresh and hot!  

Keep up the good work!
author: Maritza P.

description: just another overpriced burrito in san francisco, thats filled with rice and beans.  quick and easy if you're in the mood for a mission style burrito, but can't compare to the goodness you'd get at any taco/burrito shop in san diego.
author: omid a.

description:
Dear Papalote: I was so hungry, and so tired, and had been cooking all day and was not in the mood to make food decisions. Your lovely cashier asked me so nicely,  "what kind of burrito would you like?" Upon seeing my distressed and indecisive face, she calmly recommended the grilled veggie burrito with guac on the side and spicy sauce inside. Oh, and a watermelon agua fresca (be still my heart!) to wash it all down. I. Am. Still. Full.

Love, 
Adri's Tummy
author: Adri M.

description:
i went through a period of about six months after my big break up last year of dating a shit ton of not-so-great guys (for me).  not much can be positively gleaned from this horrendous disaster-on-top-of-disaster-experience (or, rather, experiences), but one thing:

papalote makes some seriously good burritos.

what?  how the heck did i make those connect?

if there's one good thing about dating, you get to explore the city and what it has to offer from someone else's lens.  papalote came up in the view of not one, but two of the heavy hitters in my Dating Extravaganza 2010.

both guys were *completely* different types of people.  proof:  papalote appeals to a variety of different folk.  

one guy was in-the-know of sf's eateries being from the business side of that kinda thing, so his recommendation was a stellar one.  attractive, smart, driven, and knows his stuff.  proof:  you can be fancy pants foodie and a professional...and love papalote.

the other guy was more of a sit around and play video games and eat burritos all day kinda guy.  he didn't often eat food that was complicated.  burritos were about as complicated as it got.  and the only good ones in his world were from papalote.  proof:  you could be a videogame playing, mind-altered, anxious, full-of-fears -about-mushrooms-attacking-mario, confused, twenty-something and still love papalote.

neither of these fly-by-night world-wind love of my life romances worked out for me, but one love of my life romance did:

papalote and their burritos.  particularly, their salsa.  hot. spicy. flavorful.  win.

though Dating Extravaganza 2010 is now over (thank god...), I can honestly say papalote was a good find through the disasters.  like the rainbow in the middle of the storm that lasted after the rain went away.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
Why do people cream their drawers over this place? Look, I eat here because it's close and it's not awful, but it is definitely overpriced and overhyped. The burritos are good - the ingredients are fresh, not too greasy, and I like the choices for tortillas and beans. But $8-$10 is WAAAAAY too much for what you get. Why was I able to get a burrito with twice the flavor for half the price when I lived in San Diego? Where are the REAL mexi joints around here.

And - this pisses me off to no end - 50 freaking cents for a tiny extra dollop of salsa? Are you kidding? Look, it's good salsa, but not THAT good. Not half a buck good. That's an insult - I have never been to ANY burrito joint that does that. 

They get an extra star for serving 24s of PBR. 

Don't believe the hype
author: Josh G.

description: This place is good, but honestly what makes it is the sauce.  I actually went out and bought the sauce from Rainbow Grocery and I use it at home and It makes the meal.  The burritoes and everything else here are pretty good, but I would honestly pick almost any other burrito place for their burritos -- but the sauce gets me.
author: Jonol S.

description:
Seriously good burrito! I love the fact that they grill your meat to order and through the tortilla on the flat top to melt the cheese. I'm pretty sure they put crack in the salsa. 
Parking tip: park in the Luckys underground parking lot so you don't have to circle like a vulture.
author: Ryan R.

description:
The salsa is as good as everyone claims!  Good level of spiciness and very tasty.

I also got the carne asada super burrito.  The carne asada is cooked to order and was so tender and flavorful.  If that douche Flay wins on the Throwdown tonight, I will lose all faith in the Food Network and am boycotting!
author: Jenny R.

description:
I had heard about this place for so many months before finally trying it.  I've been missing out.

And that whole time, I thought it was a sit-down type restaurant.  And while it has a few tables, it's the order-at-the-counter type restaurant.  So if you think you're being clever by pulling up to the restaurant and having your girlfriend step out to put your name in while you park, you're not -- it's not that type of place.

Anyway, I walked in, saw the pescado (fish) burrito and knew that is going in my mouth.  But that wasn't all.  See, I was pretty hungry as usual, I also got a cheese quesadilla. 

The burrito: great.  I really liked it.  and charles knows burritos.  i tried the soyrizo burrito too, that was better than expected. I'd even order it sometime.
The quesadilla: also a good choice.  It's tough to screw this staple up though.
The chips: meh.  yeah, i was a bit disappointed here.  they're edible, but you can do much better.

The restaurant itself is a nice establishment, pretty clean inside.  Nice service, casual atmosphere, decent prices. I look forward to coming back here .
author: Charles R.

description:
A friend casually mentioned this place to me since I'm a vegetarian he thought I would appreciate their food there. I looked up their menu online and 5 minutes later I was out the door and on my way to get a Soyrizo burrito!!
The food was great, they make the food right in front of you and it was extremely filling and cheap as well!

Can't wait to go back!
author: Albert Paris W.

description: The prices are great, but this is the third time I have gotten a stomach ache the morning after. I don't know what it is about the food. Nonetheless, the flavors are spot on and the sala for the tortilla chips is to die for! They should sell it by the bottle.
author: Moises T.

description: ya know, I use to like eating here, but lately I don't know what's their deal is but they have been super cheap with the meat. Like today, I had maybe 3-4 pieces of chicken in my burrito.....FOR $10! COMMON! You do that and think no one is gonna say nothing!? Foolish. Next time I'm going to Gordos, the one on Clement and 22nd, not the other two (they're weak too).
author: Brian C.

description:
I'm spectacular at pronouncing Chile Verde with a gross American accent. Really I am. If you wanted to be a funny man you'd broadcast this shit. I bet they'd be laughing all through Europe. 

What's not gross is - you guessed it - the Chile Verde Burrito at Papalote - it's hardy with spice and a sense of freshness we just don't usually associate with taquerias (man I have been living near el farlito and it's poor sanitation standards for too long). 

At this location you get the fresh product without the long 'For some reason even though I live in the mission near three billion taquerias I still have to create a line at papalote' shit. I highly recommend this manner of ordering. And I highly recommend the Chile Verde among all things.
author: Alexandra M.

description: Great burritos from this place. I prefer the Carne Asada, but the Fish is good as well. The salsa is great as well, I always get an extra.
author: Chris P.

description:
Vegetarian Mexican food is oxymoronic in my head. Two years in San Diego were a heavenly procession of tender carne asada burritos from trucks, carts, and holes in the wall. Carnitas, chicken with mole sauce, crispy fish tacos, all fillings versus veggie toppings.

I ordered the veggie super burrito on a whim: boiled carrots and potatoes with sauteed mushrooms. 

I should preface this next part by mentioning that I've lived in Florida for the past year, a place not known for its Mexican offerings.

OK, here goes: Holy cow! That was a transcendent burrito experience. Maybe there's better joints out there, but that meal was a symphony of perfectly soft wheat tortilla, tender and flavorful veggies, properly cooked black beans, fresh guac, and uniquely piquant salsa. I ate halfway through, realized I was full, and ate the rest because it was there and I had to.

I've missed the west coast, but reunion is that much deliciouser.
author: David C.

description:
This place is the shiizzz.  One of the best burrito spots I've ever eaten at.  My super burrito is under $8 unlike a lot of places in the city.  They cook the chicken over a fire as you order it.  They have this orange hot sauce they bring out with the chips that's soooo good.  I have them put that hot sauce in my burrito instead of the traditional pico de gallo.  It's so much better.  The cooks are super friendly and very polite when they bring out your stuff.  
UPDATE- I WENT THERE LAST MONTH AND THE BURRITOS WENT UP TO ALMOST $10.  I'LL NEVER GO AGAIN.  THIS IS THE DOWNSIDE TO TRENDY SPOTS.

The only downside:  not as much chicken in my burrito as i would like, and they charge $3 more for extra.  
5 stars none the less.  It's bomb!
author: Joel J.

description:
Woo hoo, in San Francisco for the duration of spring break!

Luckily, my sister lives close to this particular location. She picked up a couple of burritos after her haircut for the boyfriend and I to munch on for lunch.

We both had Poleng burritos, which aren't on the menu but can be asked for. It has chicken adobo and garlic rice and was heaven in my mouth ;_; Add sour cream in it and it is absolutely amazing! I'm so used to burritos down in San Diego and didn't a clue what to expect.

For some reason, the combination of chicken adobo, garlic rice, sour cream seemed to fit together nicely. Some of the chicken pieces were a little dry, but the sour cream made up for it. The garlic rice on the other hand was AWESOME. I'm not one to usually have rice in my burritos, but I'm down to have this kind of my rice in my burritos :) Not too sure if I want to venture and put guacamole in the burrito next time. I've never mixed chicken adobo with guacamole before :o

Before we leave San Francisco, the boyfriend and I want to try the Triple Threat burrito since my sister finally has someone to share it with :)
author: Mylene A.

description: While it's not the best Mexican place I've had in SF, it's good. I'm a big fan of their salsa, I don't know what about it gets me, but I buy them by the jars. Their burritos are alright, a little on the dry side, but with help from that salsa, it doesn't cross my mind again. While the wait time can be a little long, there's a market right across the street with free parking, just buy something and you're set.
author: Barrett I.

description:
I've been hearing about Papalote for a while now...Tim V. has been singing it's praises as long as I've known him.  I finally decided to try it out after a couple years!  It's never too late!

I ordered the carne asada burrito and it was really tasty!  I like the fact that they have a choice of beans (black, refried black, refried beans) as well as tortillas (flour, whole wheat, spinach).  Was it the best burrito I've ever had, no.  But it was really good!  

I think they should add a choice of having a burrito wet to the menu.  Also, I like having things like lettuce and pico de gallo on my burritos and they don't have that here.  Still, it's definitely a good option if you're not wanting to go to the Mission for the real deal! ;-)
author: Melanie N.

description:
Just like the other one - but with less seating.

Less seating - minus one star.

Way way closer to my house - plus one star.
author: Joe C.

description:
3.5 stars

I just had tacos cammarones and it was quite delish. Although I wish they had given me two tortillas, per taco, just to soak up the juicy salsa, 'cos that bundle was falling apart. I like eating with my hands... The shrimp were surprisingly plump, and not tiny and overcooked. Not bad with a little habenero sauce carefully dotted on. Although the real star is their salsa they serve with the chips. Smooth, spicy... Mmmm, that stuff is like crack.
author: Antoi C.

description:
meh, meh, and MEH

I'm from the city, not LA or wherever else claims their mexican food is the best. BUT I do like me some mexican food and Papalote is not the business.  Let's just say, I go to school right up the hill and only went to Papalote's once: during orientation.  Although it may seem like it on yelp, I am not the only one.  If starving 1L students take the bus or drive somewhere to get a burrito when Papalote's is so close, you know it's no good.

So, why am I such a whiner? ehh, probably because they grill their burritios (it's not a frikkin quesadilla), the burritos are DEFINITELY not big, and the burritos might as well all be called rice burritos because good luck finding any meat or beans in it.

eh
author: Josie A.

description:
Mole! Mole!
Who doesn't love a good rich, chocolate mole sauce? And Papalote has mole tacos, mole burritos, and mole dinner platters...
Sounded like a Mexican heaven to me.
I got the Chicken Mole Burrito with refried black beans.
It wasn't bad by any means, but I wanted to like it so much more.
But the mole sauce was 'just alright'. It lacked flavor. That umph. 
And the chicken was a bit dry.
Parking on Fulton is ass, even at 8pm, but you can park in the Lucky's lot across the street and buy a bottle of Vitamin Water to get yo ticket validated.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
I am so happy this place is on my route home! It makes my move all that much sweeter! 

Contrary to other reviews I have never experienced a long wait here. Maybe I have been lucky or maybe I have more patience than usual when I am getting some of my favorite foods. The salsa is by far the best and most unique I have ever had.  It's creamy deliciousness makes my mouth water. Worth the stop for just chips and salsa no question.  I am a longtime fan of the fish tacos and will be for a much longer time. I have never had the triple threat burrito but I imagine I will approve.... It will be next on my list. 

After a very recent trip to a small town in Mexico where I stuffed myself with delicious meal after the next I am proud to concur that these guys have some of the best know how in Mexican cuisine.
author: Erin M.

description:
This might be the most incredible house salsa ever to grace my tongue. 

Their vegan mole and tofu is no slouch either.
author: Tamara B.

description:
The first time I came here I was not impressed! I didn't think it compared to the numerous authentic burritos in the mission. But, I gave it another try. Now I'm hooked. When school isn't in session (I go to USF, which is about a block away) I yearn for this place. They always play great music and the burritos are good. However, the main attraction is their salsa!!! mmmmmm....I'm salivating. 

Come here for their salsa and healthy burritos. They also have soyrizo, great for the vegetarian diner.
author: Jacquie S.

description:
The cheesiest quesadillas, the warmest tortillas chips, and the chunkiest guacamole--how can you go wrong?? (That's three stars right there.)

Cheap eats. (The fourth star.)

Fast and friendly workers. (The fifth star.)

And if I could give a sixth star, it would be for a clean restaurant.
author: Maureen B.

description:
There's a million places to get Mexican food in SF, but I think that Papalote has one of the most unique salsa's in the City. 

I am always satisfied when I get a meal here, whether it be the tacos or burritos.  It is all very good food.  It's real easy to get to with the 5 Fulton and 43 Masonic passing right by it. 

My go to is usually the Super Burrito with Carne Asada or Chicken, sometimes with Shrimp.  It's close by to me which is a plus and am definitely a fan!
author: Dustin K.

description: Crappy restaurant, really rude and completely unhelpful staff, sub par food. Had ordered a few times and thought he food was 'ok' but tolerable. Went to pick up food and was completely turned off and will never go there again. Wish I could have my money back.
author: Kim R.

description:
Delicious and incredibly reasonably priced! 

The tofu/vegan mole tacos were really yummy. The mole may have been a tad too sweet but still very good. It's not that often that a non-meater can get some good mole over something like tofu. Other good options that my friends got:

Chile Verde Burrito - Really flavorful and only complaint would be that the bottom was a bit soggy. Would have been a bit better if it was wrapped in foil but otherwise it was great.

Veggie Burrito - Really fresh and was great with the green habanero sauce on the tables.

If I could I'd give this a 4.5 since the food was great and the price cant be beat. $4.75 for 2 very filling tacos is a pretty spectacular deal for the city.
author: Galeet L.

description:
After all this talk of a Papalote Eat-off between J-To and Carlos A at Nico's yelpy office hours, I was craving a burrito for dinner tonight. Jessica and I were big winners, first scoring rock star parking out front and NO line inside. When we turned around after placing our order, there must have been 10 people who appeared out of no where standing in line behind us. 

I ordered a super chile verde burrito, and Jessica ordered her favorite, a super fish burrito. Both were giant bricks filled with tasty ingredients. My pork was really tender and the fish was buttery and fluffy. Topping off with their special salsa increased the yum factor tenfold.

When my burrito arrived before Jessica's, she insisted that I start eating it, but I insisted on waiting for hers to arrive. I forgot that she was actually doing me a favor and giving me a head start because by the time she finished hers, I was only half way through mine. 

All I can say is, Carlos better start getting some competitive eating tips from Takeru Kobayashi. I'm sorry, but I'm rooting for Team Jessica.
