description: Food is awesome!!!! Great quick spot to stop by and grab some tacos and a corona.  Great chips and salsa and you get your food super quick. I've been there a dozen times or more and they have yet to mess up my slightly high maintenance of an order.
author: Courtney M.

description: LOVE this place! Healthy food that tastes amazing. I'm vegetarian so I get the Vegetable Burrito and add guacamole & tofu. They put actual vegetables in it,  so it's NOT just loaded with beans & rice. The salsa is Out Of Control. Definitely try this place!!
author: Miss Amanda M.

description:
my favorite place to get a burrito hands down!
actually not just a burrito... nachos, tacos, quesidillas, or even just chips and salsa... this place rules!

oh and you can get a jar of the salsa and take it back for cheap refills!
i have a jar at home and a jar at work!
author: Chelsea H.

description: This place might be too busy for its own good!  Nice, freshly prepared mex food.  And the salsa is tasty...
author: Tim G.

description: the one in the Mission is the one ihave been a follower of for  mucho years.  and once i heard from Me. E that a PapaL's was opening on fulton..  oh my!  happy day! its soooo much closer to mi casa! delicious, fresh and healthy mexi food..  the best salsa and chips. fish tacos, queso-dillas..  burritoes.  yum-o! and Me.E is the BIGGEST sweetheart, so how can you NOT love going here?
author: Caroline S.

description: Papalote is pretty damn good, especially when you're desperate for a burrito. I'm on the fence when it comes to the authenticity issue-- I wouldn't be caught dead eating at Taco Hell, but Papalote... sure, why not.
author: Le V.

description:
this is a pretty great neighborhood burrito place.  i walk over here a lot for the carne asada burrito, but i've also been known to get the rice and bean burrito or the chicken tacos too.  it's all pretty damn good, really.  

but what we're really talking about here is the salsa.  it's fantastic.  maybe some of the best in town. bonus, they sell it by the jar.
author: brian g.

description: This is an average quick in-n-out Mexican grill restaurant. It is a bit overpriced due to its location. The salsa is the best I have ever had. It is not tomato based, but some sort of bean paste. We had veggie and carne asada burritos. They were good, but not the best I have ever had. The staff was very busy and the service is almost none existent beyond the counter area. The restroom is always clean and orderly. I would come here for a quick meal before or after class. It is a bit expensive for the quantity of the food. The quality of the food is mediocre. The veggies consist of carrot, potato, and bell peppers. It was alright. The carne asada was a bit dry and few and far in between. I really like the options of wheat, spinach, tomato, or flour tortilla.
author: Angela Y.

description: The burritos and the salsa are my favorite in the city. Yes, I've tried the taco trucks and I still prefer the burritos here. The sun dried tomato salsa is fantastic. They don't advertise it, not sure why, but you can buy the salsa by the jar. That's why there are all those empty glass jars by the register. $6 a jar = quality purchase.
author: Richard S.

description:
not sure how Cancun gets best vegi burrito, Mister E's Papalote vegi burrito will kick Cancun's ass any day of the week. 

Grab a jar of salsa while you are there.
author: wes w.

description: When I moved to San Francisco from San Diego, everyone said I would never find better Mexican food in the Bay.  But for a vegetarian who doesn't want the shits after eating her burrito, Papalotes is the spot for me!!! The super soyrizo with black beans is my favorite, and friends and my lover rave about the carne asada and fish burritos.  They even have a frequent customer card that they don't offer (just ask!), but has paid for many free burritos. And for those who appreciate a good beat to your burrito, the music is always on point (specifically for you Marley, J-Dilla, Mos Def fans), and this is also where I gather all the flyers for Hip Hop and dancehall nights within the city. This is my one stop spot.
author: Kirsti P.

description: Your moles are awesome!! and so are your chips! and your spicy salsa dip!! and your burritos!! and your quesadillas!! Their prices are really reasonable, they're quick to go, and since they're near my school, I'm dropping in as often as I can. They're not that good for eating in, because it can be crowded sometimes, but just take some to go, walk a couple of blocks to the park and have a picnic. You'll come for seconds even before you finish your first
author: rina b.

description:
I had extremely low expectations for this place and only decided to check it out when my other favorite burrito place was unexpectedly closed for the day.  BUT!  I'll have to admit that this might be my new FAVORITE burrito place.  Chile Verde burrito was incredible.  The salsa that comes with the chips was so good!  Bottom-line: big delicious burrito for an excellent price.  
This is going to be trouble for my waistline.
author: Susie G.

description:
glad to have this in my hood, though it's really nothin' too special.
sure i'll go there if i'm craving a taco or burrito, but something's missing. can't pinpoint what that 'something' is.

the chips and salsa are pretty spectacular. i had a special burrito (the works) with the chicken, which was hearty and scrumptuous. they only have one choice of pollo (asado), and that can be disappointing for those of us who love our hand-pulled stewed, juicy, spicy chicken. 

the pollo tastes oddly like tandoori chicken, which isn't bad. 

i'll have to try the carne next time.

again, a good place to have in the hood, nice to fall back on, and i do like it. maybe it doesn't have that "authentic" feel?
author: jennifer y.

description: It is really nice not to have to haul ass down to the Mission to grab a cheap quality burrito and just walk three blocks to Fulton and grab a burrito at Papalote. I usually stick with the chicken super burrito as it doesn't fail and I don't eat beef. I like the way they spice their chicken and you can tell that they use quality ingredients. I've heard their tofu burrito is also really good but I've yet to try it. The salsa is awesome as everyone has said, I think they should sell a bloody mary with it, well, maybe not. Props for serving Newcastle beer, it goes well with a burrito. It would be nice if they would play something else other than Breakin' on their obviously expensive LCD.
author: Nicholas B.

description: I was extatic when this place came into the neighborhood!  Great burritos, and great hot sause selection.  The chips and salsa provided are really good and they come free of charge while you wait for your freshly prepared bundle of mexi goodness.  Everything is very fresh and it's a much cleaner burrito than you'd find in some other mission establishments.  No meats sitting in a vat waiting to be consumed, all orders are made while you wait.  Way better than anything in the haight area.
author: Jon S.

description: This place might not have the best burritos in SF, but all the different veggie options and vegan beans definitely make it worth going here if you're vegetarian or vegan. You always get chips and their amazing salsa too, which always makes it worth the trip.
author: Emily F.

description:
super unique, awesome salsa.

everything else? not really seasoned much. personally i found it kind of bland, heaped up with guacamole, sour cream, and the other stuff. 

chicken was pretty dry. 

to be fair, people LOVE this spot so they're obviously on to something. but for me, i'm not really a fan.

(people who work there ARE really nice though)
author: Cameron O.

description: One of my favorite places for a burrito. The chicken mole is particularly good. Their salsa is also pretty unique. Wish they weren't so stingy with the chips...
author: John C.

description: i come here entirely for the salsa. i mean, the quesadilla is good, its got cheese and meat and all the important stuff. but i could just as easily get a quesadilla from little chihuahua down divis. no, i come here for the delicious amazing secret ingredient salsa.  so pretty much i recommend ordering something you want to put lots and lots of salsa on.
author: LeeAnne T.

description: The food was absolutely delicious. Not the most authentic looking taqueria but all the ingredients are very fresh and everything is prepared well. They warm the tortillas on the flat top rather than steaming them and it seemed like they actually grill their food to order rather than having a vat of meat hanging around. The guacamole is amazing as is their salsa. The line was almost out the door when I arrived but it moved surprisingly quickly. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great burrito.
author: Alan R.

description: I'm a picky gal. But this is as good as it gets. Right down the hill from USF's campus, actually first place I ate when I landed in San Fran...PERFECTION and fairly cheap too.
author: Kate B.

description: Not even in my top 100 burritos. I know Taco trucks that have better. Ordered the Chicken Mole Burrito. The sauce was good. Beans were bland. Chicken was tough like shoe leather. Ordered the super and got about 2 bites of sour cream and guacamole. Tortilla wrap was not anything spectacular, the rest of the fillings were nothing tasty. Was not worth the wait or the hassle parking.
author: Walter S.

description: I like the idea, but my prawn burrito took 10 minutes from when I ordered, had a dry-flaky tortilla, dry rice, and not all that much prawn going on.   The chips and salsa are good, and the nice people that work there brought the food to me, which is cool.  Therefore, I can't slam it, but I won't be going to Papalote for mexican food.  Still waiting for great Mexican food in the hood.
author: Dylan C.

description: Awesome Burritos.  We used to say these were the best in the city.  I am not going to back that up anymore, but they are still REALLY good.  The place has plenty of seating in a typical taqueria atmosphere.  The Salsa is really good and if you ask nicely you can get a whole bunch of it!
author: Pele N.

description: Welcome to da hood, now where is da CARNE!!!!! Cute interior, bright and welcoming. I just wish they put more protein in my taco. grrrrrrr. wherez dat red meat....i need my iron!!!!
author: miriam b.

description:
its in my neighbohood, nuff said- i got its back. 
but more importantly, most times, its just plain awesome food. 
simply but stylin in taste. i usually just tell my folks that 'it's mexican
food on that next level'. like fish sauteed in white wine? what the...! i know! ?  when bringing a new victim in for the tastings, the voyeur in me likes to zoom in right for the mouth. yes...the corners curl at the first bite, then the tongue slinks in and around the lips for more. with that cue, i give em the enthusiastic, "oooH whhhhaat! told you".  plus, you know Dj Myster E's fam runs the joint. all the locations you can peep hip hop aesthete in the environ. (esp that they'll have beat street or breakin' playin on their flat screens or something). *b girl stance!
author: irie o.

description: Two burritos down the hatch! Good eats, but I had to fire off some serious torpedo's the next day....if you know what I mean.
author: Dr. L.

description:
The best thing about this place is the sauce you get when you order food.  The buritos taste way better with the salsa.  Also definitely get the super if you are getting a burito.  

One nice treat is the mexican coke you can order here.  The soda taste so much better since it uses sugar as opposed to high fructose corn syrup.
author: Waymond N.

description:
I expected better based on the Yelp reviews. Maybe I order the wrong thing (Chicken Mole). It was a strange tasting mole sauce, too sweet and not enough character, and it was just chicken and sauce. The chicken was tender and good, but it was boring after a few bites. The rice and beans that came with it were a little above average. The guacamole side was good.  My partner had a burrito and liked it better than I liked mine. 

I will probably go back because it is walking distance from home and I want to try other things.
author: Mara K.

description: The food is definitely very good, but it's not an authentic taqueria experience, as you can get all sorts of vegetarian options - soyrizo, tofu, etc. - and they don't have lengua or even carnitas. But that aside, the food is very tasty. Expect to pay more here than other taquerias in the neighborhood, but if you're into experimental burritos and tacos, you'll enjoy it! I've only been to the location on 24th Street and it's definitely jammin' in the evenings. Best bet is to order ahead and just do pick-up rather than wait around for a seat because it gets mighty crowded!
author: Shauna S.

description: Great place to call in an order for pick-up.  My favorite is the super chicken burrito no beans add eggplant, with extra salsa of course.
author: Jenny S.

description: Probably not the best burritos and tacos in the city, but one thing they do right: mole. I've been to a number of Mexican restaurants claiming to offer traditional, authentic Oaxacan mole, and every place I go it's too sweet or too bitter. Papalote does it very well, and with chicken stuffed in a quesadilla, yum!
author: Charlie K.

description: Simple! Use better ingredients and you get better food. This grill uses that idea to their fullest. I'm not a vegetarian but their soyrizo is something that even non-vegetarians (like me) get on an occasion. This place gives large dishes, great service y un sabor que esta para morir!!
author: Manuel S.

description: This is as good as it gets if you ask me. Everything tastes super fresh and is surprisingly cheap. I get a bean and rice burrito and add sour cream and guacamole and it comes out to like 4.50. Not bad considering the large portion and quality ingredients. Pretty speedy service, especially if you're not in the lunchtime rush. The employees have never been particularly friendly.. but never rude either. All in all, I love it! Oh, and for the record, credit card can only be used on orders of $10 or more..
author: Laura P.

description:
I really like this place, but if you're looking for authentic Mex food, this isn't the place to find it.  Despite the lack of authenticity, like I said, it's still good food!

They have different of options in terms of type of tortilla, meats, seafood, etc...  

I'm a fan of the bean and rice burrito as well as the prawn burrito!  mmmm!
author: Liz T.

description: Good - I liked the shrimp burrito's.  Quick & easy food, the guys making it were all nice.  Not many options for burritos around there, I'm glad this one is actually good.
author: Heidi P.

description: The mole burrito was great but what I really loved were the shrimp tacos. It was simple and the quality of the seafood was top notch. The only thing I haven't liked has been the pollo  achiote, due to the slightly burnt taste to it. I don't know if that is the norm or if it was in fact burnt.
author: Justin V.

description: Really fresh Mexican -- they make their own tasty kinda smokeyspicey fresh salsa every day and you can buy it by the bell jar for home consumption (highly recommended!). I love the Grilled Pollo super burrito, in a spinach tortilla -- DE-licious!
author: Emmabelle S.

description: Really!? that's how many chips I get? Really!? So, basically I have to order seventeen orders of chips and salsa to get what's normally given as one order. Anyway, I'm in the hood and ate here like twenty times and though always thought it pretty good, but nothing special, I was always annoyed at service, which was done with an indelible frown, and their 75 percent screw up my order rate. Just competent unauthentic Mexican food, who screw up my to go order and seem to have severe chip shortage, I mean your only job is to make like five different meals that consist of the same basic six ingredients, I can't imagine it's that hard, but somehow the meal is always wrong??!!. I now go to Chihuahua's in my hood, but really, the Mission is still the place!!
author: Steve l.

description: Best burritos in SF.....but you have to go to the NOPA location! The food and service at the papalote in the mission sucks! Go to the one on fulton and masonic and your taste buds will explode in orgasmic pleasure.
author: Nicole E.

description: This is a long overdue review.  Not only does Papalote make THE BEST SALSA EVER, they also have customer service that is amazing. Last fall I helped organize an event at USF law school just up the hill from Papalote. We ordered a ton of food and it took several phone calls to get the details of the order locked down, the people I spoke with were friendly and helpful and returned all my calls very promptly. They cut us a great deal and our order was ready waiting for us when we arrived to pick it up. Because they gave us SO MUCH FOOD, we literally could not carry it back up the hill. An employee volunteered to DRIVE US in her own car, giving up her parking space RIGHT IN FRONT of the restaurant in order to help us out. She really saved us and of course the food was amazing and our event was a huge success thanks in no small part to Papalote!
author: Sarah K.

description: Probably the number one USF underclassmen hang out on Friday and Saturday early evenings when the cafeteria closes early at 7, Papalote, in my opinion, has the best Mexican food in NOPA (North Of The Panhandle). The best part about it: the free chips and salsa they give you with every meal. I repeat: free. How nice is that? If you get it "for here," they bring you some while you wait and watch your delicious meal cooked before your eyes. The salsa must be some secret recipe passed down for 27 generations or something because it is exceedingly delicious. If you get it "to go," they nicely pack some chips and salsa to accompany you on wherever your next journey takes you. Rumor on the street is that the "Super Burrito" is the best thing on the menu, but I usually get the chicken nachos. However, if you're feeling a little more adventurous, I would go with the chilaquiles--they're a tasty treat.
author: Sophia L.

description:
the food is very good. but they skimp on the meat. kinda pricey. lookin at $7 an item. for mexican food... that's super steep, 
but its probably the best mexican food in the area, they kill you w/ convenience  

i miss burrito stands and baja fresh...
author: Angelo M.

description: We both got veggie burritos.  They came in at around $5 with cheese on them.  Fast service.  Decent burrito.  Whatever,  go for Farolito if you really want a burrito.
author: Tim T.

description: EAT THE FISH TACOS...fresh and delicious...I eat there about once a week...a nieghborhood favorite! (My husband reccommends the Fish quesdadillas...his new fav.)
author: Dara S.

description: Nestled next to some scaffolding and across from a Lucky's, this small Mexican restaurant boasts delicious burritos and other plates for an amazingly low price.  If you live near this place than becoming a regular is a must, if you don't live near than it's a must visit.
author: Alex H.

description:
Took a drive on Fulton last week and was met with the very pleasant site of Papalote.  I had no idea it was there.  No more struggling for parking in the Mission to get my tasty carnitas burrito from Papalote.  I can now grab a burrito when I go shop at the Albertsons and can park in the lot across the street.
Great burritos, fresh stuff, fast service.
Not too much seating so a one star deduction.
author: J K.

description:
Just finished a Super Chicken Burrito from Papalote.
Pretty marginal. I was hungry and now I'm full so mission accomplished but I can think of better ways of getting form point A to B.

The wait for my burrito was about 10min so you might want to call ahead.
author: christian x.

description: I live just a few doors down so I frequently visit for a burrito at least once a week. I've had almost everything on the menu but my favorite is the Chili Verde if I'm really hungry or the Pescado if I want something lighter. The fish is in a white wine and butter sauce that is really good. I like how they melt the cheese on the tortilla and how they cut the meat and then re-toast the chunks before adding it to the burrito. They also have refried black beans as a bean choice that I haven't found at too many places. You even get chips when you order to go. Their salsa is really good too.
author: Caroline F.

description:
An update:
Why does your marinated tofu burrito vex me so?  One day it is the perfect compliment to your tasty refried black beans, extra cheese, sour cream and guacamole.  The next day, it is dry van's shoe leather muled by burrito to my digestive tract?  Oh well, stick to the chicken burrito
author: Robb K.

description: OMG their soyrizzo burrito is one of the most amazing things I've ever eaten in my life.  It's the kind of veggie food I dream about.  This place is my new obsession.
author: Briana L.

description: i love this place.  freshman and sophomore years at usf were all about papalote.  i usually get a super pollo burrito but everything i've tried is good.  they also give you free chips.  it's a bit pricier than other burritos you'll get, but it's worth it.
author: Aishling R.

description: Excellent burritos and salsa. Love how the burrito is slightly grilled, makes it much more appetizing. Food is made to order but still comes to your table very quickly. Only reason not 5 stars is because it's not the BEST mexican food ever and I've been there a few times where the quality has varied. I highly recommend this place!
author: Kelly L.

description:
Papalote is the sh*t. Period. The day this place opened the panhandle went from good to great to potentially the coolest neighborhood around.

Where to start? The ingredients are fresh and you see them cook everything and put it together in front of you so there's no sketchiness involved. I love greasy mission burritos as much as anyone else, but I'll take a lighter/greaseless burrito over the alternatives any day of the week.

The burritos are great. Big, warm, good mix of ingredients, basically the way a burrito should be.

The chicken mole is awesome if you're in the mood for it.

The nachos make you ask for more more more.

The salsa is off the hook.

The cooks are always nice and friendly (to me at least). They usually hook it up pretty well with chips/salsa, so you don't go home hungry.

I'm from SoCal and have had a lot of burritos in my time, and Papalote is up there with the best!
author: Raphael M.

description: Fresh off it's successful stint on Throwdown with Bobby Flay on the Food Network, this small, hole-in-the-wall burrito shop has everything you will ever need from a San Francisco burrito. Personally, I prefer the Chile Verde which is pork sauteed in a green chile sauce. With it savory flavors and friendly staff, Papalote makes you crave their gargantuan burritos an unhealthy amount. Hailing from New York, I could always find enough pizza and delicious bagels to last me through the wee hours of the morning, but quality burritos were more hard to come by...I have now become a neighborhood regular at Papalote and I've fallen in love with the fresh smell of their homemade salsa, ingredients and fresh meat. I ALWAYS prefer takeout since the actual establishment is quite small. But don't be fooled by the size; the warm staff and excellent burritos well compensate for the lack of seating. Take that delicious goodness and enjoy it in the comfort of your own home...Careful about the lines as it's very popular among the USF crowd. Call about 10 minutes ahead to ensure minimum wait time.
author: Jamie D.

description: Pretty amazing. Their sauce dip for chips is great on everything! I have only tried their burritos, but I've tried most of them..I highly suggest getting it super (includes guac, salsa, sour cream).  It sometimes takes a little while for them to make your order, but it's usually because it is always busy. Yum. I think I'm going to get one for lunch now :)
author: Sarah R.

description: This place ruined not only my college graduation, but also the trust and love that my parents gave me. I am no longer perfect to them. Maybe getting drinkies the night before was also a factor, but I swear this place gave me food poisoning.
author: erwin c.

description:
Whenever we are in the neighborhood we make sure to stop by and pick up a burrito.  the soyrizo burrito is absolutely wonderful.

I would give papalote 5 stars but they are stingy with the chips and salsa (i probably would be too if I made such awesome salsa).   take advantage of being there and pick up some salsa to go.  i am not sure how much it costs, but i would pay just about anything for it.

be ready to pay a bit of money for extra salsa and chips and you will not be disappointed with your papalote experience.
author: Andy P.

description:
Papalote does a lot of things right.  They cook the carne asada and pollo asado to order, a rarity in San Francisco Burrito culture.  The portions are good, the flavor is reasonably good, and it serves a burrito deprived area.

There are problems however.  They've only got one kind of hot sauce; no pico de gallo is provided.  The burritos are a bit soggy.  Although they taste good, they don't taste like a true San Francisco Burrito...I can't figure out what's off about it.  The crowd here for dinner is mostly USF students, so you get to deal with a bunch of young rich snobs as you order your burrito.

As others have pointed out, Zona Rosa on Haight is superior and closeby the area.
author: Dean A.

description: Not "all that" - - the burritos I've eaten there have been bland. I live around the block and go out of my way to get Mexican from other places like El Burrito Express No. 2.
author: Brian W.

description: Love it. Their salsa is to die for. Get roasted salsa in burrito instead of pico de gallo. Fresh cooked meat and lots of choices. Deeelish!
author: Erica L.

description:
I paid $7 (I paid $1 extra for cheese on my burrito) for a not so large burrito.  The taste of the burrito was adequate - not great but not horrible either.  

The real buzzkill for me was the fact that they charge for extra salsa - I have never seen this before in all my burrito eating days!  What happened to having a salsa bar or just having piles of those little clear disposable salsa containers sitting on the container waiting for you to take as many as you want?

I don't plan on going back - there are too many other taquerias to choose from.  Adios Papalote!
author: John D.

description: Best Mexican food in SF!!  I've tried most of their things and the Pollo Super Burrito is my favorite.  I like the burritos better than the tacos.  Now that I've had Papalote, I refuse to go to any other taco shop.
author: Brian R.

description:
YUMMY!

The tastiest last minute, hold on I need to eat or else I'm going to implode burrito place on earth.  They are fast, and friendly and the food is good, good, good!
author: Wild G.

description: 1 carna asada burrito cost a lil over $7. Overpriced since it tasted more like a bean burrito. Paid extra dollar for a tad of guacamole. The only thing good was the creamy spicy hot sauce. I wouldn't go back.
author: allie t.

description: Great, consistent burritos, tasty salsa/sauce, fast service - perfect burrito place.
author: Yelper B.

description:
i had a 'buy 10 get the 11th burrito free' card.  when it was time to redeem it, i was charged the tax for the "free" burrito. 

the prawn burrito is probably the best thing on the menu..

salsa/hot sauce is very liquidy and they don't have their chunkier counterpart.  sad.
there are not a lot of burrito places here in the area, so i guess that's what keeps this place in business. =T
author: Angela P.

description: One of the best Mexican places outside of the Mission. You'll wait for ages on a weekend night, though!
author: X O.

description: same fabulous burrito. same delicious taco. same glorious salsa. the panhandle papalote is definitely a great addition to this area. however, it lacks the energy and the community spirit of the mission papalote. this makes me sad cuz to me, papalote is so much more than just a good burrito joint. it's a place where friends and colleagues gather to plot the next great protest over yummy mexican food albeit somewhat gringo style. i mean, after all, protesters need to eat too, especially before a long hunger strike. you know what i mean? anyway, i believe the poor layout and the lack of tables makes this papalote a difficult place to dine in. now i do understand that papalote is doing their best with the space they inherited from tango 20. perhaps papa just needs a little more time to find himself and the bustle and hustle will follow. let's hope so.
author: frisco j.

description: It's late at night with a group of friends, we're starving, we have been circling around this neighborhood for parking and a place to eat, and we end up at Paplote. First off, the cashier ladies rushed us to order because it was close to closing time and kept emphasizing that we only have so very few minutes to eat if we DID decide to stay here to eat. We ended up taking everything to go.  Pollo super burrito on a spinach tortilla was pretty good. Very flavorful meat, not too much rice, a little too much on the beans, I didn't taste the cheese, but the salsa and  guac finished it off well. I was happy that they actually had options for different tortillas (Regular, whole wheat, spinach, and tomato). One word that sums this place up, STINGY! I mean my BF and I ordered two burritos, we got our chips with salsa under our two burritos in the same paper To Go bag. Um, couldn't you have put the chips in a separate bag? Not only that, our friend that ordered one burrito,  got the same amount of chips. Not that I mind, b/c the chips were stale anyways, but come on now. I asked for napkins for my to go order and the guy hands me ONE napkin. Am I suppose to play tug of war between my BF and I to see who gets the bigger piece of napkin in the end. I ask for another napkin and EVERY one of the workers behind the counter stare at me like I committed a crime. Same situation happened to my friend. What makes it worse is the fact that burritos out of all things can get super messy and it's just a freakin napkin! Amoungst the 5 of us we spent about $50, can we just get a napkin each at least?
author: Tracy T.

description: Amazing things about the papa: the way the burritos are a little toasty, the salsa, the hot sauce, the refried black beans, the fact that its the best rice and bean super burrito i've ever had in my entire life. Their nachos are also awesome. I live across the city and drive and over here every chance i get. PS: the veggie burrito has potatoes in it - dont go there.
author: Genevieve H.

description: My favorite burrito in the city! I love this place. Good options for both meat eaters and vegetarians (they have tofu). Great tortilla selection -- flour, wheat, tomato, and spinach. AWESOME salsa. Definitely check this place out!
author: Heidi B.

description: prices are great, food is delicious, the salsa is BANGIN.  portion sizes are generous.
author: asia c.

description: This place is pretty tasty and have pretty good vegetarian options. They have a good salsa as well.
author: Sean J.

description: So I used to love papalote, but the past two times i have been there I have been severely disappointed. I ordered the shrimp and prawn burrito and they are really skimping on the shrimp. I am half way through my burrito and as I type and I have encountered one shrimp! One! I know we are in an economic hardship, but come on. Stop being so f****** stingy. Fo real!
author: Alaina M.

description:
"the guy who manages this place on fulton street (hopefully not owns it!!) has got to be the biggest ass i've ever met!  i mean, seriously.  it was the second time i had been there since they opened a few years back and it will definitely be the last.

the reason i hadn't been back in so long is because i thought the food was just ok - definitely not authentic in any way.  and here's their philosophy - "To prepare outstanding Mexican dishes
with the freshest meats and produce available,
and serve them in a comfortable and exciting atmosphere."  they're not exactly living by their philosophy.

this time when i went i ordered the carne asada tacos, and boy was i disappointed!  since when do you get huge pieces of the green, leafy part of romaine lettuce on a street taco in mexico?  i don't think ever.  there were probably about 12 large pieces - enough to cover the dry, over-cooked carne asada, and still damp enough to make the 1 corn tortilla totally soggy.  after removing the "salad" i took one bite and knew i wouldn't be able to eat them.  i took them back to the counter and that's when "mr. friendly" had to show his "macho" side.  i tried to be as nice as i could - i wasn't trying to offend anyone.  i told him i didn't mean to be rude, but that i didn't like my tacos.  he snapped, "why??  all the meat is totally fresh!" i said that i just didn't like it, there was way to much romaine lettuce and the meat was completely dry.  he barked, "no one has ever said our food isn't good!  do you want something else or your money back??"  at that point i just wanted my money back since he was being so rude.  he pounded the cash register buttons and all but threw my money at me.

never again.  i should have known better from the first time."
author: kristen l.

description: Sooo good burrito, tried the prawn, carne asada and chicken...ALL GOOD. They bring you chips and salsa for dine in.
author: Amy C.

description: the best burritos in SF. The salsa I can just drink and slurp it out of the container.
author: j l.

description: I used to think Papalote was upscale burrito heaven.  They even use chicken breast (can't figure out how they make it orange).  Papalote you could do no wrong.  Even when I found out you had "buy 10 get one free" cards and I had been eating there for months and you never gave me one thereby robbing me of a free burrito, I still forgave you.  But Papalote I think I need a break and its not me its you.  I'm sick of being charged for extra salsa when I'm a regular customer and you all probably laugh at me whenever I order, wondering why the hell does she eat here so much.  Lately your burritos have been loosely wrapped and with a lot of hard extra tortilla.  Your salsa, that used to taste like magic, is now craptastic.  Sometimes its so hot it burns my mouth and last night it tasted like sweet & sour sauce.  Not a good burrito flavor.  I have a halfway filled card right now, but I think its about time I started that diet I was thinking about...
author: Isi C.

description: BEST Burritos ever!!!! I love papalote! First, their salsa is AMAZING. I have no idea what they put in it but it is like heaven. Second, their burritos are so good! Everything is super fresh made to order and delicious. This is seriously the best burrito place in the city!
author: Tara T.

description: soyrizo burrito. pacificio. best salsa in town.
author: o'vegan m.

description: Because of Throw Down with Bobby Flay, I was anxious to try the "proclaimed" Papalote's TRIPLE THREAT BURRITO.  The WORST burrito I have ever had.  I have lived in SF for 40yrs. and have tried many Mexican places.  THE ABSOLUTE WORSE!!! I paid $22 for 1 awful Triple Threat burrito.  It was dry, tasted burnt and such a disappointment.  I wonder what was in the burrito made for Throw Down.  Could not have been the same ingredients as in the one that I purchased!!  I am beginning to wonder about the restaurants featured on Food Network.  I tried a BBQ joint in Pacifica featured on Food Net work....simply awful!!  The ribs bones were as large as dinasaur bones!!  and had no BBQ smoke flavor.  Totally BLAND!! Do these Food Network personnel know good food?!  I am done, no more restaurants will I try in SF featured on Food Network.  I cook better food than this mess!!  The Food Network owes me $22!!!!!  The one good thing I can say is that the tortilla it was wrapped in was really good!!  Anyone that gives this restaurant more that one star does not know good food. Oh, it is clean and well lighted.  It is too expensive for the mess you get.!!
author: PATRICE B.

description: shrimp burrito? hell yeah! i just had one & my tummy is STILL very happy. Fast & yummy, and that sauce they give you with the chips is TO DIE FOR. What more could you want?
author: Avery L.

description: it was very good I like that they cook the meat for the food right there and it doesn't come in some vat or out of a can
author: Nicholas E.

description: it is more expensive and smaller than your average local burrito... but does  pack a punch.
author: miss m.

description: bf used to live around the corner from this place and it's a good place to have around the corner, because you can't always get in the car and head over to farolito's when you're hankering for a shrimp quesadilla.  but you'll pay more here and your shrimp will be half the size.  everything will seem ok but not great. it will be fast enough, though it should really be a bit faster if you think of what all there is to do behind the counter.  you won't be hungry any more and you won't get sick. but you'll feel like you spent a few dollars too much for that feeling.  haven't been to the one in the mission, which always looks pretty hopping from the outside.  this one on fulton benefits a lot from the lack of other options in the immediate vicinity.
author: Nikki F.

description: perfect place to refuel after a bike ride across the bridge into marin. take it to go and plop yourself down in the panhandle, now that's the life.
author: annie s.

description: The BEST salsa in San Francisco. Why waste your time with the $0.50 side when for $6.99 you can get an entire jar of this deliciousness?!? (Bring your own jar for $1 off!)
author: Jewels S.

description: still rice and beans, just better.  i liked this place. a lot. the other reviewers are right about the salsa too, it's delish.
author: Laura H.

description: Damn Papalotes!  So that's what your working with huh?  I'd been hearing good stuff about this place for awhile and when I went to Poleng the other night, I realized Papalotes was right next door.  I went during the lunch hour and it wasn't crowded and although the barstool seating faces a wall, I had tunnel-vision like focus on my burrito, so the view really didn't matter.  I had a burritto...shrimp and chicken so I could taste both meats and boy was it good.  The burrito comes with rice, beans (I tried the black refried), salsa, and meat  (unless you get it veggie) all wrapped in a grilled flaky tortilla crust.  The salsa was great.  You could tell the tomatoes had been marinating in something all night and there wasn't a lot of cilantro, which was an automatic A+ in my book.  The meat was well flavored and the rice and beans together....well lets just say when I got to the end of the burrito and ran out of meat, I still couldn't stop eating.  Very friendly people working in the kitchen who greeted me and made a point to say goodbye (maybe cause it wasn't really busy...I dunno) and the prices were hella cheap for the portions.  $6.95 for a regular chicken burrito and (I got shrimp too so an extra $3.50 for me).  I'll definitely be going back here...like ummm...tonight.
author: LaSha G.

description: you can't beat the salsa here... mouth watering.  they cook the meat and tofu-meat when you order it which is more than can be said for some burrito joints.  seating is limited and the prices are a little high, but $7ish for a burrito every now and then is fine.  highly recommend the breakfast burrito.
author: Ken L.

description: The veggie soyrizo tacos with refried black beans were great!  The salsa was perfect, fresh and an awesome spicy kick to it!
author: Meg P.

description: the chile verde pork is full of flavor, unlike so many burritos i've sampled. there is tasty soyrizo for you veggies. the salsa is wonderfully addicting, especially for the notchunky type. the sloppynachos have gotten better recently, and are actually worth eating now. given that i live two blocks from this place, i'm glad i can get my burrito fix without trucking down to the mission.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: Okay, so I might be a little biased because this is the closest Mexican place to my house and has saved me many a time when I realized I had no food in my house/no desire to cook. But, the burritos here are awesome! I haven't personally tried anything else on the menu ( I am a creature of habit... ) but between all of my friends I think they have tasted everything on the menu and there has yet to be negative review.  The salsa is great too!
author: Roz B.

description: wow.  prawn burrito = perfect distribution of burrito innards.  every bite was damn near perfect!  i want to go back and stuff my face.
author: Oliver C.

description: I wish they had tacos al pastor, service can be surly at times, the lettuce is cut cumbersomely large, and the carne asada was a bit chard yesterday... but the sauces are to die for!  Mole, salsa verde and especially their smokey red sauce!  Yum!
author: Maria O.

description: hey, the food was good - had to ck it out - saw it on Diner, Drive-Ins & Dive's - BUT what a rip - I spent $ 16.00 for a burrito for my son & I had taco's - we asked for more ot their "special" sauce - charge for that - more chips $1.00 for those - charging for chips when you spend $9 bucks on a burrito - the place isn't that good - just hip, I guess!!  I  know plenta great mexican joints selling burrito's for $6-7 for a super.  i won't be back - the mgr was pretty rude too
author: Maribeth G.

description: have papalote nearby is such a treat. their nachos w/veggies (think potatoes and carrots grilled in a tangy sauce) are to-die-for as are the veggie-friendly burritos. do yourself a favor and while doing a load or two of laundry, walk the 30 feet across masonic to papalote. makes doing your laundry at the fulton laundraumat muy bien!
author: Bee H.

description: Right across the street from my house lies a fantastic specimen of a burrito shop.  I would have burrito's 3 out of the 7 days in a week, if they weren't so fattening.  The chicken burritos are excellent here, the carne asada, in my opinion, is a little on the salty side.  The chips and salsa are different from the typical but once you get used to them they are really good!
author: L M K M.

description: This place has some tasty food, but more importantly it has the most tasty salsa ever! Note that: even though this review is coming from a person who has a 32oz. bottle of Tapitio in her fridge, Papalote's salsa is not too hot, its perfect! I always ask for extra! Although you have to pay for extra, which is a bummer... Perhaps everyone asks for extra salsa so it becomes a huge cost to them. However since they are not a huge chain, I don't mind paying extra for some of there fantastic salsa. This is the location closest to my pad which they opened after their Mission location became a hit!
author: Cindy M.

description: I love Papalote.  Aside from any claims of "real Mexican food," they have a great tofu burrito, so that I'm not left getting the usual bean, cheese and rice burrito.
author: Amanda H.

description: These burritos are pretty legit. The tortilla is always crispy and fresh, and the meat is tasty without being mysterious or of questionable quality, like many of the places around the Mission. I have to admit though, sometimes the mystery is half the fun, and it often seems to add to the unique flavor of a burrito, so some might find the Papalote burrito a bit bland. Luckily, their salsa is fantastic and makes up for it all (it goes well on pizza too). Try the chicken mole.
author: Matt C.

description: great place for healthy clean mexican food.  i don't do mexican food outside of the mission but this is the exception to the rule.  nothing fancy here but the food and the ambience is nice and clean.  the one thing that pops out about htis place is their orange sauce.  a good salsa does a lot for me when it comes to mexican restaraunts and so if they didnt have this sauce i may have rated this place a 3.5.  if your gut is muffintoppin from all the sourcream and oil from real burrittos in hte mission, then come here for some guiltless mexican food and feel better about yourself.
author: Daniele S.

description: Their salsa is like a chilly almost, minus the beans.  I don't know what they put in it, but it's unique and good!  Rated best place outside the Mission for a burrito by me.  And you can take your beer to go...nice.
author: E G.

description: This place is my "to go" dinner of choice.  The burritos are fresh, the salsa is delicious, and the service is fast (as fast as food prepared after you order can be).  I have taken to calling in my order ahead of time so that I don't have to wait.
author: Erin B.

description: Best burritos in SF. Their meats are all grilled to order, not pre-made and sitting in a warming box. The chicken mole burrito is absolutely amazing too. Just found out you can buy their addictive salsa by the jar too - but be careful, it's like crack.
author: Jay N.

description:
third time's a charm, and now i'm a convert.

today i was hungry. hankering for a good burrito. 
it was 3pm and i hadn't eaten anything...trading food for sales at stonestown...i digress...

conviced that there are no good burrito joints in my hood, i decided to give papalote another try. and i was glad i did. 
the place was packed, and i took my super grilled chicken burrito home. it was delicious, and i'm so excited to have good mexican eats close to home. fantastico!
author: anita h.

description: This is great reasonably priced Mexican food and healthier/ lighter than most taquerias in the Mission.  I love the tofu or chicken mole burrito, and the chicken quesadillas.
author: Amy M.

description: props for having a wide selection for my vegetarian hombres, its a great compromise when my carnivore and herbivore companions battle over where to eat. quite possibly the best priced super rice and bean burrito i've found. quality background music as well.
author: p c.

description: i love chipotle so i'm always a tad standoff-ish when presented with a new burrito place.  seeing as i live fairly close to this establishment, i thought i'd give it a try.  it's like chipotle, but far more authentic.  great dirty burrito!  love the ambiance...guac is less than extraordinary tho.
author: Steve G.

description: Hands down the best burrito place outside of the mission. Not authentic but delicious with really fresh ingredients. I prefer it over the so-so greasy burritos in the richmond and you leave feeling satisfied but not weighed down. I'm usually in there once a week sometimes twice. The only reason it gets four stars is because they sort of skimp you on the salsa that you have to pay extra for.
author: Veronica C.

description: I was hungry for lunch, saw this little place and decided to give it a try.  I ordered the carne asada burrito (super).  While waiting I noticed they cook and chop the piece of meat for your order right as they are ready to put it in the warm tortilla. No mass cooking, chopping and warming stations like in many Mission District taquerias.  The slight toasting on the outside of the tortilla gave it a nice texture to bite into and the first thing I noticed was the absolutely fresh taste of the salsa.  This is a well-made burrito with each bite giving a great mix of flavors. The meat was tender and flavorful, the beans stood up and said "present" and the cheese was just the right amount of gooey goodness.  This place has taken the pedestrian taqueria fare that you find in the Mission and made it fresh and yummy.  The fresa was delicious, too.  If you're in the mood for a taqueria you really need to try this place.
author: Eve C.

description: Well priced, authentic Mexican Taqueria that uses fresh ingredients and is ideal if your on the go. Worth making the 10 minute walk if your in the Haight and have a hankering for Mexican food, as the taquerias in that area are bland. The burritos are well made and won't collapse, and if your less hungry, I reccomend the Fish Tacos.
author: Jeremy J.

description: so it's been said about 250 times: the SALSA is amazing. but i'm still unimpressed with papalote. would give a 2 star if not for the salsa. the grilled chicken burrito is good but the carne asada tacos suck. and they don't have carnitas?!?!?!?! wtf is up with that? most of the seating is bar style facing a wall which i find awkward and not conducive to conversation (like the seinfeld episode.) but of course i will always come here because it's so damn close to school!
author: N. M.

description: amazingly delicious! kinda overpriced but worth it. right around the corner from USF. really good ingredients, feel great afterwards, full but not nasty. the burritos actually stay together, they're big but small enough to fit in your mouth. you should definitely go!
author: Shan C.

description: 3 words, triple threat burrito. yeah it's super expensive but dayum it's good. i love this place because its good an near my house. i also like the random decor items like insect shaped kites hanging from the ceiling and the random videos they play. the food is good and the service is good too. all around, you cant go wrong here.
author: A G.

description: The one in the Mission is better.  I am mostly saying this because the guy at this one running the register was one of the rudest people I have ever dealt with.  I ordered a super chicken burrito, my boyfriend heard me.  It wasn't super ,no biggie, I went up to ask for some extras, he ignored me then when he finally acknowledged me instead of hearing me out he asked what my number was, I don't know 27?  Then tells me no I did not order super and dismisses me.  Um hello I still wanted some stuff for my burrito.  I sit back down and then think no I would like a little sour cream so I go back up, "what?" he barked.  I politely told him I would be happy to purchase some sour cream, that was gonna be a dollar.  Mind you upgrading to a super is only 99 cents and you get all sorts of things.  Thanks dude, thanks a lot.  Go to the one in the mission if you can, better food, nicer service, more room.
author: Annie D.
